Reviews.Title: “Excellent overall, great for kids!!”
Reviews.Author: areasontosmile
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Sydney for a short break with 2 adults and 5 children. We booked a 3 bedroom apartment through a Trip Advisor promo link and got 15% off the price which was great! From the moment we arrived into the carpark we were very impressed and the service from reception was very good. When we reached the room ad opened the door we were very impressed! We had a corner 3 bedroom and it was huge! The veiw was outstanding and the children were speechless. It was worth it just to see their faces when they looked out the windows, which they spent a lot of time at. And not to forget the swimming pool on level 61, fantastic views from it as well!! Overall we had an excellent stay at World Tower and will always look to see if there is availability at World Tower any time we travel to Sydney!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Relaxing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sean R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on a business trip and found the rooms to be of a very good standard. The hotel is also within walking distance of great amenities which is always good. The room itself wasn't the largest but it was more than made up for by the comfort of the bed (which was outstanding) and I will be staying there again when I am next in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view and great location”
Reviews.Author: Kylie R
Reviews.Content: As a family of 4 including two boys 10 and 13, we had the best 4 nights. Would recommend to all. Short walk to the train and light rail and above mono-rail station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great for families”
Reviews.Author: Charlie B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meriton World Tower in Sydney for three nights. Our apartment was on the 68th floor and the views were incredible (although not of the harbour). The apartment was spacious, open, bright and well equipped. It was smartly decorated and very tidy and well furnished, but nothing really that a 2 year old could damage. We stayed in mid-April which is slightly at the back-end of the season, and found that the price was less than the equivalent of two adjoining hotel rooms elsewhere which, with three children, was the alternative option we had. I would definitely recommend this place, it has a modest pool but it is on the 61st floor and not particularly busy so the kids could splash about without worrying anyone particularly. The views from the pool (floor-to-ceiling windows) at night was also incredible - a nice place to have a swim! There is a supermarket in the adjacent shopping centre and George Street, which has numerous buses to Circular Quay (opera house/bridge/Rocks), was 30 seconds walk away. The reception staff were helpful and accomodating and so, all round, this was an excellent option for Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment, amazing views - even better than Meriton Kent Street”
Reviews.Author: talk2mrjones
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a 2 bed unit on 67th floor. Receptionists were fast and friendly. We got 3 keys/elevator passes and zoomed up the ultra fast ear popping elevator to floor 67. We were so impressed with our rooms. The view over toward Hyde Park was stunning. The rooms are quite sizeable and were well equipped with everything we needed. Meriton Kent Street (we stayed 3 nights in 2 bed unit there) is great but this is even better. Room ambience and decoration is superior here and view is more dramatic due to the extra height. Location wise there's nothing to choose between them. Only criticism my wife thought carpets were a bit dusty. Supermarket in the basement is very convenient and a taxi rank outside the front door is so convenient for airport transfer. No fuss on check out just drop your keys off and jump in a taxi 5 meters away. If you want apartment accommodation in Sydney CBD you will be very pleased with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Freame
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Dec 2011 to see the Harry Potter Exhibition. Our party was myself and my two kids and two nieces. We had a 3 bedroom corner apartment and the amount of space was incredible. Two of the bedrooms were massive and the master had an extra sunroom space which was lovely to have my morning coffee in and read my book. Very clean, great kitchen and bathroom facilities. Downstairs underneath is a shopping area and very conveniently a Coles so stocking up is easy. The Monorail is right next door too and we used that extensively to visit Darling Harbour and to get to the Powerhouse Museum. I would definitely stay here again as the price was very reasonable for the accommodation we got and the location and views we had.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views.”
Reviews.Author: dtreeby
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a 18 day cruise around south Australia and South Island of New Zealand. Took time to negotiate the car park but eventually found our way to reception. Couldn't get to our 2 bed apartment until 2.00pm so left the luggage in their safe room. Found the apartment clean and spacious. We were on the 65th floor and the views from each room was amazing - in fact my cousins in the second room didn't draw their curtains at night because they didn't want to miss anything! I asked for the sheets /towels to be changed after the second night as our cousins were swopping and this was done. The apartment had everything that you need and there are plenty of shops near by including a Coles.There was a party going on very loudly in the next room and we thought this would disturb us but by the time we returned it was quiet - they do say no parties! Although the hotel is large the reception staff are very friendly. We will never stop enthusing about the view.

Reviews.Title: “What a great location for city activities”
Reviews.Author: Golftraveller1984
Reviews.Content: The location of World Tower is second to none if you are looking at doing Sydney CBD Activities. It's a stones throw away to george Street for movies, pubs, bars, restaurants, a 10min walk to Darling Harbour, the Convention Centre you name it. Our favourite was the short walk to China Town and Australia's greatest chineese restaurant - The Golden Centuary! The only let down of the stay was no mini bar in the room as its a serviced apartment. But everything else was great. We even had a great view of the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: cavillino1
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located Parking is easy to access, hotel is right on george street just past queen victoria building. Rooms are very spacious with all new fit out. The two bedroom on higher floors are larger so above the 64 floor as they have sitting areas, on the lower floors they will sometimes look the third bedroom to allocate you a two bedroom suite all have two bathrooms full kitchen laundry etc (one bathroom has a bath and shower and the other just a shower) and because you are so well located just catch the lift down you will find endless food choices and Coles supermarket just downstairs. Everything is walking distance and if you like a bit of room when you stay somewhere rather than just a hotel room then this is the place for you this place will quite easily accomodate a family of any size. Security is also excellent within the hotel and the best thing is if you not city savy then this one is so easy to access airport is only 10- 15 mins away too. By far the best thing is the view you will love this one

Reviews.Title: “Great for groups”
Reviews.Author: kaz0908
Reviews.Content: I stayed at World Tower for 4 nights with 4 friends while attending a conference. We had a 3 bedroom apartment on the 64th Floor. The views are fantastic and the apartments were spacious and clean. Each bedroom has either a king zip bed or can be made up as 2 single beds - this is a big plus for group travel. The lounge area was spacious with plenty of seats for everyone. I have stayed in 2 bedroom apartments before with only a 2 seater couch so it was great to have space and comfort to relax after shopping or a long day at the conference. The location was great, walking distance to Sydney Entertainment Centre, chinatown, darling harbour etc with plenty of places to eat close by. We made use of the pool which is on the 61st floor - great view over the city. I did even use the gym once, for such a large complex the gym did seem rather small but my friend and I did have it to ourselves at 6.30am.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay @ The Meriton!”
Reviews.Author: FlyJayClass
Reviews.Content: Have recently stayed 2 nights at The Meriton Apartments World Tower and I absolutely loved it. The property is fantastic if you are traveling with friends or in a group. We had a 3 bedroom apartment on the 66th floor which was absolutely massive and had amazing views over Sydney. I could spend ages just sitting in the living area staring out the windows, day or night. The apartments are modern and extremely comfortable and the bedrooms are large and offer all the comforts of home and then some! I was traveling with two friends and their baby and there was more than enough space for everyone. My bedroom / bathroom alone were larger than most standard hotel rooms....by a long shot! I would absolutely not hesitate to return to the Meriton World Tower and look forward to staying again at some point in the future. The ONLY somewhat negative thing I have to report about this property is that the air conditioning in the unit was only so-so. Being up so high with floor to ceiling windows throughout, on a sunny day the place really heats up. We managed to cool down the main living area but the vents in the bedrooms felt as if they were barely letting in any cool air at all. It was explained to us that there is one main air conditioner unit that services all the apartments on an given floor. My best advice on a sunny day would be to keep the blinds down and all the bedroom doors open when you are out and about exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location”
Reviews.Author: Andy S
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, disappointed with Penthouse. Stayed in the Penthouse Suite, expected everything to be functional and nice.. The ensuite smelled like smoke and there was cigarette ash on the floor, the handle on the toilet door was broken (and led to someone getting trapped in there), the aircondidioner in the Bedroom couldn't keep up when the sun was shining in the window, the tap in the kitchen was broken, and the floor was sticky. Obviously someone had a -huge- party in the room the night before, as we were forced to wait over 30 minutes before we could check in while they cleaned the room. In my opinion the room wasn't fit to be let.

Reviews.Title: “view thru the eyes of a "newbie"”
Reviews.Author: bettyluvstravel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this and other meriton properties in sydney on many occasions over the years, and cannot fault them. My grandparents were heading off on their 1st overseas trip in many years (due to ill health), so as a way of thanking them for all the wonderful things they do for our family, decided to book a 3 bedroom apartment as a surprise,and what a surprise it was for them. We had apartment 6908 on the 69th floor, which was fantastic for location, space, and views to die for. We were actually able to drop them off for their cruise,then go back to the room and watch them sail off into the horizon. Very convenient for shopping, eating out and exploring... my grandparents are "hooked".. even the reception was great, which has not always been the case here, well done meriton, you have made two grandparents extemely happy, was worth every cent...will be back again and again :) highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view from the 75th floor”
Reviews.Author: 19robbo66
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, thanks to its imposing stature, my family enjoyed a short break at these Meriton serviced apartments in Sydney. An excellent location for exploring the city with easy access to buses and the nearby Museum station with direct rail access to Sydney airport. We upgraded to a 3 bedroom apartment, mostly because we liked the idea of a higher floor. The views did not disappoint. The apartment was spacious and comfortable. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful with a quick check-in after a delayed flight. Lots of dining options are very close by as well as a supermarket for groceries (which always seemed very busy, but useful). The receptionist gave us a handy tip to use the free 555 tourist bus that travels along George Street and takes visitors to Circular Quay (where you can visit the Opera House or take a ferry ride across the harbour). Don't miss a visit to the beautiful Queen Victoria Building with its up-market and interesting shops too.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent view! Superb location! Very nice pool and sauna!”
Reviews.Author: etarmo
Reviews.Content: Magnificent view from 66th floor! Perfect location in the very heart of city in Sydney! Very nice pool and sauna on 61st floor! Two-bedroom apartment was very large and nice, grand TV set, awesome views, everything modern and luxurious! I mean even the dishes in the kitchen! Our family with three kids really enjoyed every moment of our stay! It is just amazing to look at Sydney lights from 66th floor on night-time. Certainly a billion dollar look!

Reviews.Title: “Sydney visit”
Reviews.Author: amg181
Reviews.Content: We stayed in World Tower Apartments in Sydney last week. On arrival we were upgraded to the 74th floor into a three bedroom, with one bedroom locked off. Apartment was spacious, very clean. Fantastic full sized kitchen lounge and dining area. Two large bathrooms. Lovely views. Staff were friendly, with the exception of one male staff member on the front desk. Who I found to be very unhelpful on a couple of occasions. Otherwise everything else ran smoothly. There were only two of us, we had heaps of room. If you were staying in Sydney with your family it is a good location and great for a family. There is a gym and small swimming pool on the 68th floor. Fantastic view. They did post notices in the lift that they were busy between certain times of the day. Sometimes the lift did seem to take a long time to arrive. But it is a very large building, so some delays during busy times can be expected. Lots of good eating close by. Railway station 3 min walk. Good bus service and walking distance to the main city. Monorail station at this building. Great location. Would stay here again, which surprised me because I have always stayed in Darling Harbour or Circular Quay. Happy with this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience for families”
Reviews.Author: whitefox1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights with our 9 month old baby in a two bedroom apartment. The apartment was fantastic, with modern decor, two bathrooms and wonderful views. A full kitchen was provided, with utensils and plates etc (not that we used them, we ate out!). The apartment was clean and tidy with minimal signs of damage by other guests. The building itself is easy to find, as is the parking below. The elevator/lift was able to take us directly up to our room on the 70th floor (although sometimes you had to wait a while for the lift to arrive). The building is located within World Square, with reatil shops, cafes, restuarants, supermarket, pharmacy etc. This made it very convenient for us with our baby, as we were able to get breakfast and lunch without straying too far. The building is within easy walking distance to China Town and Darling Harbour, which made it great for dinner and a walk. World Square also has a Monorail station, making it easy to get into the city and back for shopping with the baby. It is the small things like this that make travel so much easier when you have to schedule your trip around baby feed and nap times. The staff were very helpful and friendly, even when dealing with a security system issue that prevented us from being issued with keys when we first checked in. We would definately stay here again. Having stayed at many of Sydney's 5 star hotels (when we were a child free couple), we would pick this hotel over those now that we have a child in tow.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: TravllrBayofPlenty
Reviews.Content: At the end of Jan 2012 a group of us travelled to Sydney for a long weekend & chose the World Tower Apartments. Check in was prompt, we left our luggage downstairs while we went out & about due to early arrival. Our apartment was on the 65th floor, great views of the city (& of the Chinese New Year celebrations) , excellent layout inside with everything there. The pool area on the 61st floor was also welcome after a long day in the city. The apartments are handy to everything , and I would not hestitate to recommend them. No problems encountered at all.

Reviews.Title: “A room with no view”
Reviews.Author: leitstrahl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom apartment for two nights and had been really looking forward to this. Check in was friendly, but beside the required AU$ 200 credit card bond they took a copy of our passports without asking for permission. Our apartment was on the 63rd floor and a total disappointment. There was no seperate loggia in this particular apartment (some layouts of other two bedroom apartments seem to have one), but only the main living room, Meriton names "loggia". The view from the "loggia" would have been towards Darling Harbour and into the offices of the building next door, if it had not been blocked by a massive structural element in front of the windows. That meant when we were sitting, we had the view of a wonderful grey structural element. You would not expect that for more than AU$ 400 per night. And you would not expect the neighbours above you to have a party until five in the morning either, thanks to the "no party policy" of World Tower. It could have been a nice stay. The furniture was up to date, the cleanliness-factor was o.k.. World Square and its shops are easy to access on the ground levels and the monorail station is almost in front of the door. But all in all it was a total disappointmet.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice”
Reviews.Author: idelgado
Reviews.Content: Beautiful apartments so very well equipped! The rooms are very spacious, clean and stylish, the location is perfect, the fitness room and pool are great, what else could I ask for? I really enjoyed my stay. When I am back in Sydney I will surely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: TennBoy
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, ready when we got their. Great location near train and bus terminals. Right on the monorail line. Price was nice also. Only negative was that the bathroom sink stopped up but they fixed that within an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: colinpoyner
Reviews.Content: Great location and value for the money. The views were stunning overlooking to the city and the apartment was well maintained and clean. Rooms are spacious , very clean and stylish, good place to do business. Also a nice swimming pool, with Sauna and Jacuzzi to relaxed. Great accommodation and amenities. Staffs are friendly and polite. Great stay and satisfied by their services given to us. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't reccommend this place more highly”
Reviews.Author: Matthew E
Reviews.Content: This place is truly amazing, and great value for money. I stayed with colleagues on a work trip, sharing an apartment with 3 other people. The apartment was just beautiful, so spacious and stylish. The best thing was probably the view from the 70th floor which was just an incredible panoramic view over Sydney. The facilities were also great. The hotel has a small gym, but with most machines and some free weights. Also a nice swimming pool, with sauna and jacuzzi, again with amazing views over sydney for the 60 something-th floor. To summarize, an amazing stay and I recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view from an amazing apartment”
Reviews.Author: philljan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 2 bed 2 bath apartment on 69th floor with panoramic view of Darling Harbour and beyond. The extra glass sunroom was a great spot to sit with a coffee relax and just appreciate the view! King beds in both bed rooms large screen tv in large lounge dining area fully equipped full size kitchen etc etc! I could live there!!!! No complaints from us!

Reviews.Title: “Meriton World Tower Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Andrew W
Reviews.Content: Good central location with easy access to rail and subway links We stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment on floor 72! Fantastic views over Sydney and Darling Harbour with full length windows. Decor is modern and well maintained. Kitchen well equipped with oven, microwave, fridge/freezer, dishwasher and all utensils. Flatscreen TV;s and DVD for entertainment. By only bug bears/complaints, the air conditioning is on a 4hr timer so you get rather warm in the night once it turns off....crazy! Secondly only 4 lifts serve the top floors and you need the patience of jobe waiting for a lift!......and lastly, you have to pay for internet or go down to Starbucks and get it for free.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely apartment in a great location”
Reviews.Author: eclare19
Reviews.Content: High spec rooms, clean, fantastic views and a great location. Only issue was the plugs in the bathrooms were dodge and the air con was on a timer so it kept going off. At the right price I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great location and awesome views!”
Reviews.Author: Jillyjils
Reviews.Content: twe rented a 3 bedroom at meriton, there were 2 other meriton around the area but we settled for world tower. it's really convenient with a cafes, restaurants and supermarket just a lift a way! the views from the apartment were amazinggg!rooms and amenities were clean and well kept! my only complaint is that they do not have wifi!its cable broadband. other than that, the price is reasonable for the quality they provide!

Reviews.Title: “The Total Package For Families - Views, Facilities & Location”
Reviews.Author: FreeSpiritBrisbane
Reviews.Content: When we managed to tear ourselves from our 180 degree view over Sydney of which Darling Harbour took centre stage - we couldn't speak highly enough of the facilities and furnishings of our 3 bedroom apartment on the 70th floor of Meriton World Tower which we called home for 5 nights (3-8 Jan 2012). Totally child friendly (security access only to floors/apartments) and with the Monorail at our doorstep to deliver us to any number of stops within the CBD, within a short walking distance to Town Hall station which led us to beautiful Circular Quay/Sydney Harbour and the icons that can be found there and a multitude of cuisines on offer at our fingertips. We could not fault this establishment. With huge bathrooms (ensuite with spa and second large bathroom) air conditioning, a large kitchen with all bells and whistles in addition to a large laundry (top loader washer and separate dryer) and a HUGE combined lounge/dining room with magical views over the city our children (13, 11, 7 & 3) not too mention us (2 adults) where very satisfied. The kids were very impressed as one of their bedrooms had their own TV in addition to the main bedroom and the lounge hosted a huge Plasma TV/DVD/Foxtel channels. Daily changing of towels, emptying of rubbish and general clean up also made the holiday a tad more relaxing. (Bed linen is not changed on stays shorter than 7 days). I also enjoyed the serenity whilst hubby took the children to level 61 and the pool/spa and sauna area. This property is a definite choice if travelling with large groups to Sydney that want to stay altogether. A must for parents with small children to avoid having hotel interconnecting rooms which can then lead to many problems and a very expensive mini-bar bill!!!! There are also 2 bedroom apartments available as well. Looking forward to our return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: Lisatait
Reviews.Content: Just got home from staying a couple of nights in a 3 bdr apartment here with my brother, sister-in-law, & their two children. From the moment we arrived, the service was outstanding! We got a high level room with fantastic views! Reception was very helpful with our every request. I will definitely make this my no 1 place to stay in Sydney from now on!!!!! 5 star luxury with 5 star service ... What an achievement so missed by others!

Reviews.Title: “Best views in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Jason C
Reviews.Content: Wow, if you have not stayed in a high rise apartment, book now. To see Sydney like this is amazing. The services and comfort are also excellent, easy parking and plenty of space, mush better than smaller hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Sari-Saurus
Reviews.Content: One of the best apartments ever. 2 big bedrooms with separate bathrooms. Fantastic view. Big spacious living room with a 42 inch flat screen. Fully equipped kitchen including all devices needed. Rooms seem to be sound proof as no disturbing noise could be heard. We got a really good price via Booking.com Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great family accommodation in Sydney during new years”
Reviews.Author: ytravel18
Reviews.Content: We book a 3 bedroom apartment for a family holiday during the new year eve period. Pros: - great view overlooking the Darling Harbour from the 74th floor, from which we had a great view of the fireworks display on new years. - modernity furnished and comfortable apartment suitable for families as we could cook and do our laundry at our convenience with a supermarket located in the mall downstairs. - the apartment if located in the city centre with good transport links (taxi stand and monorail station right downstairs) Cons: - not sure if there are any views of Sydney Harbour Bridge and the opera house for those who specifically want those views. - wifi does not come with apartment but you can purchase for $18 per day. - during our stay we had to wait quite some time for the lifts with some being out of order. Overall, we had an enjoyable stay and would return when we are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - recommended”
Reviews.Author: purple-lallang
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in a 2 bedrm apt on the 69th floor. Great location and fantastic views - near to supermarkets / subway stations etc. Clean apt with a spacious bathroom in the master bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent will stay again”
Reviews.Author: jtga6
Reviews.Content: Excellent venue and location, great staff and superb apartment. Couple of small niggles, a/c on 4 hour trimmer, ok when you are up, but not good at night - quickly sorted, by getting external contractors in, initially thought it would be the next day, but did it that evening - now that is service and throughout the manager was great! Other niggle, could do with cloths airer - not all things can go in the tumble drier. There was some confusion on wifi as it was included in Penthouse, but was initially told had to pay extra, again this was quickly and cheerfully sorted. The main a/c unit for the living areas was very loud - but the one for bedrooms was fine, so not a real issue - in fact didn't raise it with the manager. Views were amazing and apartment was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, luxury apt. at great price in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tboy2000
Reviews.Content: We were placed in a 3 bedroom apt. though we had booked a 2 bedroom. The apt. was very spacious and luxurious, with a beautiful kitchen and spa tub in 1 of the bathrooms. The view from our 72nd floor apt was gorgeous, looking out over the city to the ocean, though we couldn't see the opera house harbor area. We arrived early and our luggage was stored for us in a secure location until we returned to check in. The location is excellent, in the heart of the CBD, though a good 10-15 walk to the Circular Quay. The price was very reasonable, a lot less than if we had booked 2 separate hotel rooms in the area. The downside would be that they don't have the concierge services that you would find in a hotel if you needed that kind of service. Also there was very limited TV and spotty internet service

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous!”
Reviews.Author: Petit95
Reviews.Content: Great service n great views! Our room was 6607 and we will definitely come back. The price is very reasonable by Sydney standard. Everything is provided for and being an avid cook, the Miele oven is a pleasant surprise. Very helpful and courteous receptionist as well! Minerva P of Singapore

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the views.”
Reviews.Author: soo_what
Reviews.Content: This is not Sydney's best accommodation. The apartment is large well after we got moved the first room we had seemed not to be used very often, smelt very stuffy and with the lift right near the room it was going to be very noisy at night, so if booking asked to be away from the lift was told all the rooms are near the lifts which is not true one room away from the lifts makes the world of difference,after being moved to a higher floor and as said one room away from the lift it was a much larger room and lost the stuffy smell. The apartments are well located with a coles downstairs in the shopping centre well contained kitchen roomy bathrooms and large main bedroom and decent size second bedroom the beds do not give you a good nights sleep very very hard and uncomfortable beds,but it's all about the views the winter garden is what keeps your coming back to World tower.

Reviews.Title: “WOW !!!”
Reviews.Author: MumDadAndTwoKids
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroomed Penthouse on the 72nd floor. The apartment was MASSIVE and the views were breathtaking. The apartment was well appointed and clean (except for a fairly large stain in the carpet) and exceeded our expectations. There was free Wifi and the Nespresso machine was a real bonus. TV in every room (though with THAT view, it was rarely on). 2 bathrooms and 3 toilets meant that it was a really comfortable stay for us and our extended family. If you book early through the website you can get some really good deals (we paid $495 a night (which is good value for 2 familes or 3 couples). Each room has a king bed that can be split into singles. Whilst this is not a hotel, there are still hotel like services. If your coffee runs out - it is replaced. Your bed is made every day, towels replaced. The local restaurants even offer 'room service' and there is a very efficient and lovely team of people to attend to any other house keeping/maintenance issues (the only one we had was the ipod dock not working). Each bedroom has the facility to charge iphone/ipod through alarm clock or sound system.All this with the bonus of a full kitchen and laundry so great for an extended stay. The monorail is just next door. If you are a family, got to the monorail website and there is a voucher to download for discounted 3 day family pass. $40 for 3 days (normally $23.50 a day) Attached to the building (underneath) is also a shopping centre with a good sized Coles and liquorland for supplies and a food court (open late) Overall, really excellent !

Reviews.Title: “Great location on Pitt Street”
Reviews.Author: Jojobiz
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a two bedroom apartment. The apartment was large and well furnished. It was clean. There a lot of windows so you have great views. The staff is helpful and friendly. The only draw back is that there are only three elevators for numerous floors. It can take a while for an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: samsonSydney
Reviews.Content: As always Meriton comes up the best. We stayed on the 77th floor. My husband and I, adult son, 18 year old granddaughter. We needed a 3 bedroom apartment to accommodate us all. The views from this apartment were the best. It was like a small house. When we checked out my granddaughter needed stuff she had forgotten in the bags that were being stored. The staff member unlocked the room for us and nothing was too much trouble. I cannot speak highly enough of the Meriton Apartments in Sydney both Kent and World Tower.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Views”
Reviews.Author: Leisa R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Meriton Serviced Apartments World Tower with a group of girlfriends and all I can say is that the apartment was absolutely brilliant. We stayed on the 71st floor and the views of Sydney were unbelievable. We had a three bedroom apartment with a sleek kitchen, two modern bathrooms and very stylish furnishings. We were close to all that Sydney had to offer and we all enjoyed the whole experience. I would highly recommend anyone to stay at this Hotel and sit back and absorb the magnificent views.

Reviews.Title: “3 nights in Meriton World Tower”
Reviews.Author: tantrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroom 2 bathroom apartment. The rooms were clean and kitchen well equipped with Miele appliances. The apartments were situated in a very central and convenient location. I was initally quite disappointed when we did not get a room facing Darling Harbour and one side of the apartment faced the Ernst & Young office! But come nightfall, the sparking lights of Sydney made up for it. We did not have any major complaints about the room. Some minuses: - the shower head kept falling off it's holder, which was annoying. The water pressure in the shower stalls was also not very strong. - One of the staff at the reception was really not welcoming at all! He really didn't seem very friendly and gave us a very poor map of Sydney. When I asked for a better street map, he said that they didn't have any other! I subsequently asked another staff at the reception later and got a better map. - you can pay for a late checkout at 1pm, but any later and you will have to pay the full night's rate. However, you can store your luggage in a storeroom for free. - aircon automatically switches off every 4 hours. Although it was not a problem for us, I did not feel stuffy in the middle of the night, it might be an issue for some others I suppose. - the toilet roll holder in the second bathroom was located in a place where you could not reach it when sitting on the toilet bowl (can you believe it??)!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just for the views!”
Reviews.Author: Margotjolly
Reviews.Content: This week I stayed here due to meeting commitments. I was sharing an apartment with other delegates. For someone visiting Sydney it would be a great way to get a handle on her majesty - the harbour, some great buildings and some interesting ones. I lived in Sydney for 23 years but this was a new way of looking at her. And the accommodation was damn fine. Clean, well appointed, nicely decorated with everything you would expected of a serviced apartment. This was a business trip but if I was going with family to the city for another event this place would be high on the list. I also heard the pool is great - though too busy to check out...next time!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: mariebut64
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at these apartments along with 5 other families. Each 3 bedroom apartment easily accommodated 2 families with spectacular views from every window over the fabulous city of Sydney, As we were leaving on a P&O cruise the next day we were able to watch the cruise ship travel through the Bay from our apartment which was a highlight. Stylish and very comfortable decor, extensive cooking facilities and 2 bathrooms which was great. Would highly recommend to families/ couples as situated close to Darling Harbour and Circul;ar Quay and offered 5 star quality for a fabulous price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly staff, easy base for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: BlondeFreya
Reviews.Content: Fantastic rooms, great views, very quiet. I wish we had left more of our time in Sydney just to relax. It seemed a pity to return to the room to just collapse in a heap. We didn't even make use of the spa! The beds were super comfy and shower was fantastic. Our apartment on the 76th floor was lovely. We struck up friendships with people during the long lift ride up and down. From this base we spent lots of time in Darling Harbour, Market Town and Circular Quay. It was an easy walk to the theatre when we decided to see a show. It was great to be able to leave our bags in their store room once we'd checked out but before we left Sydney. I would definitely go back with friends or my family. (oh, and the girl at check in noticed that it was my birthday and wished me a happy one!)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in late October for a conference and it was a great hotel. We were a 10 minute walk from the conference in Cockle Bay Wharf, in the center of everything. They even put us on the 75th floor, so we had these amazing panoramic views.My only criticisms was the toilet kept running and the lobby didn't seem like a hotel lobby. Few couches, no bathrooms. Other then that it was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Deborah G
Reviews.Content: My family of 6 just stayed several days in Meriton World Tower. WOW. 5 star quality. 180degre e views, Harbour Bridge, Darling Harbour, Ocean, City. floor to ceiling windows in all rooms to maximise the view. 20 minute walk to Circular Quay and Bridge, 10 min walk to Darling Harbour and restaurants. Right in the heart of Sydney restaurant and shopping district. Spotlessly clean, modern decor. Crisp white sheets and beds that feel like sleeping on a cloud. Staff were lovely, very friendly and helpful. I recommend the penthouse. Lots of space for a family or group. I have stayed in various 5 star hotels around the world and this is as good as any.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a family stay”
Reviews.Author: AussieIbu
Reviews.Content: Our family of two adults and two children spent three nights here in a 2 bedroom apartment. It was a most conveniently sited base for us. The mono-rail was at our door and with a three day ticket we were able to make good use of it. The ticket also had discounts for places like Imax and the Maratime museum which was a saving. We could easily walk to the CBD and Darling Harbour too. As others have said, the choice of eating places was fantastic. The apartment itself was not just a place to crash, but part of the fun. We all spent ages just watching the city life below us. The night lights were lovely. Our aspect was looking to Darling Harbour, room 6805. There was cable TV in the lounge,a very big flat screen, and a smaller TV in the master bedroom for when we tired of looking at the view. Also good lighting for reading in various spots. My husband found the internet reasonably priced. The children made use of the pool. Adults were doing laps but we all respected each other's space. In fact many of the guests seemed to be celebrating on the weekend, and rides in the lifts were rather fun. We rode with several hen's nights groups dressed up for partying on the town, but when we got back to our room it was very quiet. There are lots of stipulations of the hotel's no party policy and the consequences for breaking the rules. We had to sign a document agreeing to this on booking in. The check-in staff were very friendly and efficient and storing our luggage was no problem. One disapointment was the master bedroom had 2 single beds. We had paid extra to have the children's beds split, but I think they would have been anyway. Reception said they would get housekeeping to push the beds together and remake it, but when we returned late it hadn't happened. Having slept in the beds we weren't inclined to waste clean linen and just let it go.I let reception know on check -out but there was no discount, just an apology. When I asked for a new ironing board to replace a broken one, it arrived within minutes. We have all agreed we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend”
Reviews.Author: taumanu
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at the Meriton Serviced Apartments World Tower, Sydney over the long weekend. It was a fantastic experience and we were all very impressed with the apartment on the 69th floor. Fantastic views of Darling Harbour and surrounds, very comfortable, well equipped and sparkling clean, and the location was just perfect. Would return again at any opportunity. Requested an early check-in which wasn't available, but understandable with a full house, and we were offered a place to store our luggage, and a room to freshen up. Cannot fault this facility. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: AussieStrategist
Reviews.Content: Nicely furnished, helpful staff and plenty of nearby facilities make this an ideal property for a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, friendly smiles”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan L
Reviews.Content: There is not much about the Meriton that is unique, but for what they do, they do well. Unfortunately I bump down my rating of "very good" to "average" due to one poor incident. During my three night stay there, the staff was always friendly to help and very accommodating. The rooms were well kept and tidied up, and it was a comfortable stay. However, during my checkout, I confirmed with the receptionist over the telephone that I would be checking out around 11am (later than the usual checkout time). I made it down to checkout at 11:15am, and they were adamant about charging me the late checkout fee ($50 if memory serves me correctly). Perhaps I'm asking for too much, but I'm quite used to at least a 15 minute grace period in the service industry, especially when having had verbal confirmation about OK'ing a late checkout earlier in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “First visit”
Reviews.Author: Jupiter010
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with great apartments. Floor 69 with great views over the city. Very clean and well serviced. Liesure facilities and pool o.k but sauna not working.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: temps13
Reviews.Content: Absolutely brilliant accommodation - Floor to ceiling glass, fully equiped with kitchen, cocktail kitchen, laundry, 3 bedrooms, lounge with 50 inch plasma, dinning area. Magnificent views, fantastic staff and security. Luggage storage before and after your check in/out. Ideally located in Liverpool Street. Cnr Liverpool & George St. George St has the Apple Store, Queen Victoria Building and The Strand. Close to free buss service NO: 555 which takes you to Circular Quay - find this on either side of George Street (beware this service starts at 9.30am and is very packed on the first couple of trips). From Circular Quay you can catch the 333 bus to Bondi. Or a ferry to Manly - oh and if you have children aged 16, then they are charged as adults for any travel. Only students living in NSW are able to get a concession - shame this does not include all students who can provide a student Id card :-( Liverpool St is an easy walk to China Town, Darling Harbor, little longer walk to Circular Quay, Opera House and the Rocks, and then you are on your way to the fabulous walk over the Bridge to Milsons point and Luna Park (good rail service from this point, should your feet give out on you - or another option is the ferry which takes you back to Circular Quay. $5.30 per person) and they run every 1/2 hour (there is an information point where you can speak with someone and retrieve the timetable, prices and destinations). There is also a brilliant little bakery just at the back end of the train station here. Would thoroughly recommend this accommodation, especially Rm: 7704 highest floor NE corner (apartment is literally directly under the World Tower sign in the picture of this homepage - on your right). I stayed with my family (husband, 13 & 16yr old sons & 2 relatives visiting from the UK). We were all extremely impressed. The main bedroom has a walk in robe and large bathroom with spa bath, and has extensive views from all windows - a parents retreat away from the rest of the apartment. It has a beautiful swimming pool on the 61st floor with sauna and spa. In addition the views are amazing from this area. There is a Coles store located within the complex (underground), in addition to numerous specialty stores, coffee shops, and shopping complex. The Monorail which takes 14mins to do a circuit is located right next to the entrance of World Tower - cost $20 per family (4). You can stay on the Monorail for as long as you like for this price, however once you have exited the terminal, your ride ends. Worth going around and experiencing this mode of transport, and then hop off at your choice of destination, as as Darling Harbor which is outstanding. All in all it is a fantastic accommodation choice, especially if you require that little bit more from your holiday. Sleek, stylish, impeccable and truly unexplainable views..... must be seen to be believed. Oh and don't forget your binoculars to view the P&O liners pulling into Sydney, the fireworks that may just go off unexpectedly as they did for us, or the cricket at the SCG. Get checking the holiday sights and go and experience Sydney and it's views in the best accommodation I think you can buy. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Style with a Veiw”
Reviews.Author: Marzbarmareeba
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to experience this wonderful hotel while holidaying in Sydney. Two bedrooms on the 67th floor with a veiw that gave me vertigo. The moment I opeaned the door I knew I was in for a treat with the floor to ceiling glass (in the entire appartment). Extreamly well presented, new tastefull furnishings that blended well with the appartment without obstructing the veiw. The master bedroom was an appartment in it's own right with a fantastic jet tub and granite bench tops. The view of Darling Harbour as I awoke the first morning was so immpressive I thought one was still asleep and in a wonderful dream. The second bedroom, although smaller, still had the flow of elegance which carried on to it's own bathroom, which was as emaculate as the master bathroom. The Kitchen was smaller then I would have liked altho it was modern with everything thought out and a great use of space. From the kitchen to the formal lounge room with a large flat screen TV, DVD, CD player and a very cosey sofa, tastefull art on the walls and furniture to match. The main focal point was the small (atrium) I call it. A taseful table and chairs and a veiw to die for. Warning take your time to gather your thoughts before taking on the view from this room as it seems to overhang the building, I was a little dizzy at first but soon relaxed into it. Reception was very helpful and the service was extrodinary. A two bedroom cost $375 per night and it was worth it. Hope you all have a chance to experiance the Meriton Serviced Appartment World Square Sydney. Happy Holidays from Marzbar

Reviews.Title: “Quite Happy with Meriton World Tower”
Reviews.Author: Jackal11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Meriton's World Tower apartment during October, for five nights. When we checked in there was amix up with room allocations, so our booked 2 bedroom apartment was upgraded free of charge to a three bed apartment, which really suited us as we were travelling with two adults and two small children. The first thing you notice at World Tower is the incredible view. We were on the 62nd floor looking down over Darling Harbour and surrounding areas. The kitchen, living room and bedrooms were very clean, although the bathroom floors had not been fully cleaned from the previous occupants, which was surprising and not very appealing, but not a huge deal in terms of overall satisfaction. The apartment was decked out with the modern furniture, kitchen appliances and entertaiment facilities. The beds were comfortable and the service staff dropped by each day to check if we needed anything. The hotel is situated right in the middle of Chinatown, so there's plenty of atmosphere at ground level. Restaurants and shops were seconds away with a stroll down George Street to Circular Key or The Rocks taking fifteen to twenty minutes. Overall we were quite happy with Meriton World Tower. Had the bathroom floor been spotless, we would have found the hotel to be outstanding. All in all, a good stay in a great area with a brilliant view!

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment, such a shame it was spoiled by such poor service.”
Reviews.Author: linda t
Reviews.Content: Regardless of how beautiful the apartment was, I will never stay here again. This was about the 4th or 5th time I have stayed here, each time was for a different occasion and with different friends/family members. The last 2 or 3 times, I have had a bad experience, so it was my fault for not learning the first time. This time, will definately be the last, because it was meant to be a very memorable moment for me. We were there to celebrate a very special occasion, and our stay was cut short. We found the security guards very imtimidating and unprofessional. Without going into detail of what happened, one security guard actually came up to me and apologized, after realising he had ruined our night and I had a long four hour drive home. We were also charged for items in the apartment which we didnt even consume and also a late checkout fee when we checked out on the same day we checked in. The previous time I had stayed, the security guard and person at reception were just rude. The security guard didnt even know how to get to their own carpark. Also, we have had 1 other group of friends and 2 other family members who have had bad experiences there. So, if you look around the city, there are plenty of apartments that are reasonably priced with views that are just as spectacular, if not better, and more importantly service that will keep you coming back and treat every customer as a valued one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view And great location”
Reviews.Author: Linda C
Reviews.Content: Just recently returned from meriton world towers with a friend and our 16yr old daughters. We were blown away by our view (6605) over looking darling harbour. We easily walked to capitol theatre & the fabulous new Westfield shopping centre under centre point tower. We caught bus to bondi & then to circular key - all very easy. My only complaints - no sharp knives & Check out staff not overly friendly however all other staff very helpful. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious central location”
Reviews.Author: Bmwroadster
Reviews.Content: Very spacious. Good location. Staff were hit and miss. Down side was no wifi and telephone signal poor. Also pool wasn't clean. Good facilities in apartments. Ask for darling harbor side. Better views

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here, such horrible staff and service!”
Reviews.Author: Valued_fair_customer
Reviews.Content: Service at world square meriton is horrible! The security guards are very rude and so is the front desk staff and manager. It is also a rip off do not stay here! Ridges next door is much more reasonable and I would recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment, not so great service.”
Reviews.Author: sugarbunny230311
Reviews.Content: Was at World Tower just a few days back with my family. Location is central, the views are to die for and the apartment is generously sized though I would have wanted the rooms to be bigger and the living a little smaller. We were in a 2 bedroom apartment, where both bedrooms were rather cramped. The Master Bedroom had a TV, and a bench for the suitcase. The second room had none, making it inconvenient for us to have to place our belongings outside in the living room instead. I suppose if you are traveling with your immediate family, it is fine, but if you are with friends or extended family members, it will not be so pleasant to have to constantly dig for your clothes, etc in the living room. As some reviewers have mentioned, this is a serviced apartment, so we should not expect five star service from the staff. However, I was just at another serviced apartment in Melbourne and they provided exceptional service every day from valet parking to bathrobes! I found it strange that the housekeeping was inconsistent. On some days, they provided sufficient toiletries and towels. On other days, they only left us with a bar of soap and insufficient towels. Not a huge problem, but strange, till I bumped into some of them hand carrying their equipment in the lift and I realised why they kept running out of things to provide the units. Shouldn't they be using the standard trolleys / carts like other hotels do? Also, since the unit only provided one hair dryer to be shared by every occupant, we have placed it in the living room for easy access instead of in the master bathroom. First two days, housekeeping relocated the hair dryer into our master bathroom. Both times we repositioned it outside. On the third day, they simply TOOK the hair dryer away altogether! Hmmm, did they not notice that the hair dryer was plugged in implying that we did need to use it after all. Anyhow, again not too big an issue, we called reception and they replaced another one immediately. Other things like washing detergent and dish washing liquids were not adequately provided as well. Again, they ran out of things on the way? So, you might wanna constantly call them for things like these, or just buy some on your own. The housekeeping team also apparently cleans your apartment more thoroughly with vacuum cleaners and what not on Mondays and Fridays. They don't. We still saw the same dust clusters at the same nooks and crannies when we got back. One thing to note is that the air conditioners turn themselves off after every four hours. This is really tiring, to have to get up in the middle of the night and switch them on again. If you are traveling to Sydney during Summer, you might wanna reconsider. You will return to a burning hot apartment, and you will perspire in your sleep. There is only one control panel for the air conditioning, so irregardless of who wants it colder or warmer, you have to compromise. If you are wondering whether it is easy to get food around the apartment, yes it is. However, it is mostly Japanese and Korean fare. There is a Coles supermarket just round the corner which is very convenient for those of you who want to cook. Just be sure to check that the cooking hood works cos ours did not work at all during my entire 9 day stay there. The bedrooms do not come with table lamps, only some dimly lit LED bulb lights wall mounted on the wall. It definitely makes reading in bed tougher, and you can forget ambience lighting. There are no lamps throughout the unit as well, so you can either have it really bright with their halogen spotlights, or none at all. The second bathroom shower piping must have been connected to the laundry and dishwasher ones, cos everytime someone uses these appliances while you are in the shower, the water goes ice cold one moment, and burning hot the next. So, be careful what temperature you set your shower at. It apparently did not affect my parents in the master bathroom, so I suppose it is only to the smaller bathrooms. All in all, good looking apartment, great views once again, and central location. However, bits and pieces of our stay there just did not add up to the standards you would have wanted for a place this price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ADroin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment for 10 days (3 adults and 2 children). That was on the 75th level and the view was absolutely breathtaking. All apartments are located between level 62 and 77. The level of equipment is very good (42" flat screen TV, dishwasher, laundry washer with separate dryer, etc.). The World tower is located just above the World Square Shooping Center, with all you would look for (supermarket, pahrmacy, phone shops, restaurants, etc.) and within walking distance from Harbourside, Queen Victoria Building, Sydney Tower, Hyde Park, Paddy's Market, Chinese Gardens, etc. We will definitely get back there on our next Sydney holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect. Great Location, Awesome Views”
Reviews.Author: alam555
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with 3 young ones and could not be happier. Great location. Supermarket underneath open late. We had no issues staying there. Would definitely recommend to all. The location is excellent. All the major bus routes and walking distance to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and facilties”
Reviews.Author: UncleBucksunderpants
Reviews.Content: Well appointed and spacious apartments in great location. Access to the airport is quick and cheap as the location is on Liverpool St and you can go via Redfern or the freeway. There are always taxis out the front. Every form of public transport is at the door step. There is a Coles Supermarket in the basement and every other shop nearby from Gucci to Nandos. We were on level 69 so our young son spent the whole time watching the planes at eyel level through the floor to ceiling windows. I booked in advance and when I checked the internet before arriving the rate was lower. Meriton changed my booking ot the lower rate without any fuss. We previously lived in Sydney and frequently visit and now only stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: Pete_Helen_Lucy
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place to stay. Very modern, well appointed and roomy apartments, with great views across Sydney. You will never get a better view than the one from the swimming pool at the upper levels of the building. Location is also very good. Within walking distance to most of central Sydney. Can be pricey at times, but booking ahead usually assures a good deal. Being an apartment building there is no restaurant, but there are so many restaurants on the doorstep that it isnt a problem. Also is a supermarket and liqour store in the shopping centre under the building. These apartments have been our first choice in Sydney for a few years now.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Room”
Reviews.Author: DianeNSW
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 bedroom apartment for two nights 8th & 9th August, 2011 to accommodate 6 people. The hotel put us into the most amazing 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment we have ever seen. The views were over the city, coast, Sydney Harbour and Darling Harbour. Our rooms were lovely and beds made up as requested into 6 singles. The apartment was massive in size with a full kitchen, laundry, large dining table, large lounge room with two oversized three seater lounges and two arm chairs with coffee table and large ottoman - one large flat screen tv and a smaller one in the main bedroom. There was in addition to the kitchen a sink/bar area. We had Miele appliances, large fridge, dishwasher & microwave oven. They also provide a desk and chair in the lounge room with modem (wifi costs extra) and in the main bedroom there was a large bath in the ensuite with separate shower, twin basins, heated towel rail & a toilet. Our apartment was lovely and clean and ready before 2pm so we were given an early check in plus an 11am check out. What a wonderful stay, thank you Meriton.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC - FANTASTIC - FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: nellie027
Reviews.Content: After a rather rocky start to our stay in Sydney ( a change of accommodation) we found this little gem of an apartment and we didn't want to leave. We had a fabulous 2 bed apartment on the 68th with the most amazing views ever of Darling Harbour and beyond. The apartment was open plan, very clean, light, airy and furnished to a very high standard, it had everything we needed and more. The kitchen was very well layed out - in fact the whole apartment was very well designed - and equipped, the bedrooms were big and spacious with ceiling to floor windows - same as in the lounge - one was en-suite the other had its own spacious bathroom and really comfy beds. The apartments were serviced to a high standard every day. The World Tower is in a very central area, monorail station next door, food shopping court 5 mins away, handy for lots of restaurants etc, about a 45min walk to circular quay, opera house, bridge via Pitt street - Elizabeth street - Hyde Park, easy to catch a bus to Bondi or ferry to Manly. The reception staff were very friendly and efficient. We had a brilliant stay here and were sorry to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for a larger family - incredible value too!”
Reviews.Author: BigfamilyEncino
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sydney for 6 days with our four young children and this hotel was simply perfect. The rooms are spacious, clean and well-appointed with a washer and dryer in the unit, simple kitchen and great layout. We were on the 73rd floor, which delighted our children - especially when we watched fireworks below us one evening. When our dish disposal broke, it was fixed within 12 hours. The hotel location in a Chinese area of town is central and interesting. There are many good restaurants in the building as well as a full market on the lower level. The rooms are cleaned daily, and they replenish with little packets of dish detergent, laundry detergent etc. The 60th floor pool was fun, the front desk guard was friendly and helpful (though most certainly not a concierge). The monorail has a stop right in the building too. The apartments were just a great base for a family that is independent and does not want to drag young kids to 3 restaurant meals a day. The price was more than fair for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in the sky!”
Reviews.Author: Flowertot_9
Reviews.Content: Arrived here for a 3 night stay with friends and their little boy. 7 of us in total : 4 adults, 3 kids. Had booked a 3 bed apt and got one on the 64th floor! To say we were thrilled was an understatement! Wow the views of the city were amazing - you could only get a glimpse of the bridge but could see the rest of the city really well! The apt itself was immaculate and very well presented! With seating areas to 3 sides; living area, dining area and master bedroom! There was a fully functioning kitchen and laundry room too. Our friends often stay in a hotel nearer the Harbour but both said this was better! Very accessible to monorail which was just outside door and only s couple of minutes walk to train station. Well worth it, had a fab stay!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific view and location”
Reviews.Author: SJX
Reviews.Content: I had a room on a high floor and the view of Sydney was amazing. Central location with lots of restaurants nearby. Very good value for money as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic view, dodgy A/C!”
Reviews.Author: CLM24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only 1 night, for Kills concert. Upgraded to 3 brm. loved the view & size of apartment. Allowed early check-in, no extra cost, staff friendly enough.Beds pretty hard & unforgiving! A/C turns off after 4hrs & it never seemed warm enough in the apartment. No extra blankets available either! Huge Plasma tv...but it only had AV reception! Having to pay for wifi is a bit uncalled for considering the price of rooms. Can't beat this place for location though!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view, great location... and did I mention the view?!?”
Reviews.Author: Jag96
Reviews.Content: We will definitely stay here again. The apartment complex is right next to a monorail station and a short walk to the heart of the city and Darling Harbour. We purchsed a monorail family pass for 3 days for $50 which was very worthwhile. Our apartment was lovely - well furnished, maintained and very clean. Loads of space and of course the amazing view! Swimming pool was awesome but a little cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place! Big, clean, and great location. Make sure you face the "good" side”
Reviews.Author: SirCyrus
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was a great stay. Location can't be beat. Close to everything in the city, has plenty of places to eat literally metres from the front door, ranging from Subway, Hungry Jacks (or Burger King to non Aussies) to Japanese, Korean and Middles Eastern restaurants. There's also a Coles supermarket around the corner which closes at midnight. Since I'm an Aussie, the sites of the city didn't stand out for me as much as they would for most tourists. What stood out for me were: 1. Ground floor is called Level 10 (ten). Hence any floor you think your serviced apartment is on is really 10 floors lower. Think level 62 sounds good? Nope- It's really 52. 2. The size of the place. Big. I mean really BIG. I've been to serviced apartments in Hong Kong, Bangkok and Tokyo, and let me say this place was twice as big as I expected. I put some of my stuff all over the kitchen, and it's so big it barely makes an impact on the mess-o-metre. I now understand why check out is 10am, but check in is 2pm, instead of 12/2 like most hotels. I've also been inside a similar 2 bedroom serviced apartment in the Pitt St Meriton serviced apartment. There, ground floor is called Level 11 (eleven), and the 2 br apartment was half the size on mine **big grin**. 3. View. I ended up facing eastish, so missed the iconic symbols like Harbour Bridge, Opera House etc. When you ask for a room, request one which faces the pretty stuff. Mine was room 6*02. 4. Attractive and modern. Large LCD or Plasma tv in living room. Oddly enough, there was a CRT tv in the master bedroom. Master bedroom has an en suite with towel racks which are electrically heated- turn onthe power point, and it heats the rack. A useful novelty since it's winter in Sydney at the moment- around 13-15 degrees celcius during the day. One last thing. You get what you pay for. The daily room rate at this Liverpool St Meriton was roughly double the rate at the smaller roomed Pitt St one. Hope my somewhat disjointed review helps someone! SC

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Girls Weekend Apartment”
Reviews.Author: tdunlop
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a Sydney girls weekend. We had a 2 bedroom apartment on the 63rd floor. The views were amazing!!!! The winter room was just perfect for having afternoon / evening drinks while watching over Sydney during daylight then watching the night lights. Then it was only a short taxi ride to Darling Harbour. You could walk it but we chose to be lazy. We did have a toilet in our apartment that would not stop running and had to be turned off leaving us with only one bathroom. That was a little bit of an inconvenience but we were only there for 1 night so it wasn't the end of the world. One word of warning though - If you are checking out on a Sunday morning prepare to wait a LONG time for a lift to get you down to reception. We waited over 15 mins and every lift that came down was full to the brim. We ended up catching a lift up and riding it back down - I would not really recommend this. It took a very long time stopping at each floor and when you are the one stuffed up in the back corner of a full lift for that long it is not all that fun. I would defiantly return here.

Reviews.Title: “I WILL BE BACK!!! BEST LOCATION! BEST VIEWS!!”
Reviews.Author: rollo_100
Reviews.Content: We just checked out today after a six night stay in the 3 bedroom apartment! I can say I totally loved this apartment! I will be back! My parents stayed at a nearby hotel and spent pretty much all their time in our apartment because they were so impressed with it. The moment we walked into our apartment we knew we had made the right decision! I was so impressed with the whole process, booking, check-in and out! The apartments are close to everything, Coles is downstairs and the monorail station is pretty much in the same complex. The free city bus departs from George street and the stop is around 3 minutes walk from the apartment. My only complaint is that the apartment needed a maintenance check, basic things just needed to be fixed, such as leaky shower-heads, faulty light switches and loose door handles. Having said that, we reported the fault with our ensuite light and it was fixed the following morning. I would recommend this apartment to everyone and my only regret is that I didn't buy an apartment in this building!! Also when booking a 3bedroom make sure you ask for a high level and a room ending in 07, or 08 because they are the largest and main bedroom and dining room include an awesome winter garden/enclosed balcony!.

Reviews.Title: “LOOKING FORWARD TO RETURN”
Reviews.Author: GypsyAustralia
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here over the past 2 years around 10 times. Have tried a couple of other hotels, but Meriton World Tower is the place to stay. Sometimes I have stayed here with my husband, other times friends - we have all loved the place. Great indoor pool with great views, spa and sauna. Lovely spacious apartments, good bathrooms. Just recently they have refurbished the apartments, so nice and fresh. If you get an apartment you do not like on arrival (which has happened a couple of times) just let them know and they will do all they can to please you.

Reviews.Title: “Great for bigger groups and famliy trips”
Reviews.Author: StaceyErin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment (6 ppl). As I had not booked or looked the accomadation up prior to arrival, I was expecting just a run of the mill apartment for the price I had paid. However on arrival I was blown away by the size of the apartment and the VIEW - AMAZING! It was modern, very clean and huge!! Massive beds too. Great location easy to walk anywhere in the CBD, there are also some great cheap cafes just minutes away that did good breakfasts! I have booked to stay there again in a couple of months time, very easy and cheap to book through their own website.

Reviews.Title: “Meriton World Tower Amazing”
Reviews.Author: micsgirl
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 (2A and 4C aged 7-13) stayed in 3 brm apartment for 5 days. Requested high floor on North East corner as previously tipped here. We got room 7506 which is the highest north east corner 3 brm other than penthouse. Great rate of $445 for sat night then $221 each for other nights using Entertainment card. I checked the hotel rate(stayz) and it was more although on the day before we left it did drop to same price. All up, we thought very reasonable. The apartment was amazing. Plenty of space for us all and there were 3 tvs so kids more than catered for. Great kitchen, nicely appointed bathrooms and we liked the beds. We used the pool and although it was a little cool, the kids had a great time and happy to swim each day. We never had problem with waits for lifts as previous posters have mentioned, and front desk staff very friendly and helpful. Fresh towels arrived within minutes of being requested. Having laundry facilities was great to. Location was perfect for us. Coles supermarket downstairs, monorail stop as well and plenty of places to eat. Sanctuary Hotel on cnr Liverpool and Kent very reasonable bistro. $7 for kids meal and sundae. Din Tai Fung very good dumplings too. Obviously the view was outstanding....by day and especially by night. I had asked in the forum about this place or Quay Grand 2brm(same square metres but 2brm vs 3brm). Very happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “WOW....$166.00 for a two bedroom for a night”
Reviews.Author: Queen_of_Dreams
Reviews.Content: Well the apartment was clean and very roomy. I could not find a bad thing to say. Staff let us check in early at no extra fee, as we were there at 12.30pm. We stayed on the 63rd floor. We only stayed for one night, I got the room on a last minute site. Beds were clean and good to sleep in...Pool area looked fantastic even though we did not bring our bathers. Everything you need is in walking distance or a free bus ride away (city loop). I would recommend to friends at the price we paid...

Reviews.Title: “people should remember that this is a serviced apartment”
Reviews.Author: cendut
Reviews.Content: Forget all the luxuries and extra touches that you would normally get from a 5 star hotel.. even from a 4. This is an apartment, there will be no bell boys that will help you carry your luggage(s) to your room, no room service, no doorman, no dial a number and expect housekeeping to pop in your room in 5 minutes.. none of that. You get rooms, a full and complete kitchen, laundry, some shampoo and bath gels, a menu of restaurants that provide deliveries, two people down at reception that will help you while typing on their computers, and that's it. So what makes this place so great? LOCATION. I had a taxi budget of 500 australian dollars for my 10 day stay and used 50. You just walk anywhere. You do not need to use the monorail either, just walk and walk. 5 minutes to the darling harbour. 5 minutes to hyde park. another 5 to the qvb. From hyde park it's 5 more to the botanical gardens. then another 5 to the opera house. from the botanical gardens go the opposite direction for 3 minutes and it's the nsw art gallery. 8 minutes from the world tower to the pitt street mall. You will pass countless restaurants, coffee shops, malls, grocery shops, delis, kebab places, and of course bus stops. Apart from the location, you also only need to pay for the above facilities I mentioned (room, laundry etc) without having to pay for room service, doorman, bell boys and the spa! You get 300 australian dollars for three bedroom per night, instead of 1200 australian dollars per night at a hotel! This is what you need.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent apartment in Sydney's CBD”
Reviews.Author: dooragan
Reviews.Content: At around $330 a night, these apartments are a great option if you have a few friends or a family wanting space, comfort, great location and fantastic views. Three bedroom apartments have a dining space, kitchen, laundry, en-suite and bathroom. The views of Sydney are superb. Well equipped and offereing everything you need to be fully self sufficient, the apartments are ideal as a base for seeing the city. Situated in the entertainment district and not far from Chinatown, you are right in the heart of the action and close to the rail and bus network. Plenty of great food options within the immediate and supermarkets for self catering are also close by. No problems at all with any aspect, the Meriton is a fantastic option if you're looking for space for a family or a group of friends.

Reviews.Title: “3 bedroom apartment, great!”
Reviews.Author: antoinettemcauley
Reviews.Content: Was really nice there, they had a nice pool on the 60th floor, and everything was clean and modern. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families/Big Groups”
Reviews.Author: cambridgechica
Reviews.Content: While in Sydney for a family trip to Australia, we stayed at a couple of different accommodations: a double room at the Holiday Inn at the Rocks and a 3-bdrm apartment at the Meriton World Tower. The reason we did this is because my younger sister used her hotel points at the Holiday Inn so that we could save money on a couple of nights stay. Plus, with my older sister coming in on our third night, we went from a party of four grown adults to a party of five. Clearly we needed a bigger space. Although there are many great things to say about the Holiday Inn, there are more great things to say about this apartment. We checked in to a pristine 3-bdrm, 2-bathroom apartment on the 72nd floor. Not only did we have much, much more space for the next few days, we also had fantastic views of Sydney (we could see Darling Harbour and beyond from our apartment!) and more importantly, for me, this apartment felt more central than the Rocks. Tons of restaurants, bars, Westfield Sydney, Pitt Street shops, Darling Harbour, the monorail are all within walking distance. One afternoon, we even walked to the Opera House, which only took about 20 minutes. Having a kitchen is great, so we were able to make our own breakfast in the mornings and even enjoyed delicious take out from a nearby Korean restaurant one evening. (I normally don't do take out when traveling, but we had a nice comfortable kitchen/dining area/living room so we figured, why not enjoy a nice evening in with food + wine after a looong day of touring the city?) We were also able to do a small load of laundry, which was a nice plus. At about $60 per person per night, I really think this place is a steal! You get pretty much everything you get at a hotel (even housekeeping and room service), but in a more comfortable space. And again, the location is superb! The only complaints about this apartment are (1) there's no free WiFi; and (2) service was not always reliable. One morning, we asked for something from the front desk (I forgot what), and it took them 20 minutes to bring it up. Still, we all loved our stay at the Meriton World Tower. If I ever make it back to Sydney someday, I hope to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment.”
Reviews.Author: scottie02
Reviews.Content: Good location. Close to everything. Apartment clean and modern. Great views.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment/condo with hotel features in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Fr0mHawaii
Reviews.Content: We shared a 3 bedroom apartment with another family (total of 4 adults and 3 teenagers). The hotel staff was very helpful with sightseeing suggestions and transportation information. The room had a great view, very clean with a nice kitchen with a full-size washer and dryer and was recently rennovated. The Meriton was in a very central location next to the monorail with shops, restaurants and a market downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but the views are amazing.”
Reviews.Author: TripVisorAustralia
Reviews.Content: The rooms are uniformly spacious, with stunning views over Sydney (though not necessarily of the harbour). The furnishings are modern and stylish and the bathrooms are clean to a fairly high standard. Reception is pleasant and efficient, if a little clinical. The pool and gym facilities are great and quite popular. With a great inner-city location, the only draw-back is the price.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: JulzieJ1
Reviews.Content: We had one of the 3 bedroom apartments which are on the top floors - views are magnificent! Within easy walking distance to Darling Harbour although we also walked the Circular Quay really easily. The place is modern and HUGE - we felt like we had so much room. Got a good deal online, but if 6 people stayed here it would be a total bargain. Shopping centre is right underneath the hotel for anything you need, also swimming pool and gym both on high floors so you get amazing views while you're working out. Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star with 5 Star prices”
Reviews.Author: 3ofusAuckland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment on the 72nd floor. When booking I asked for a quite apartment. I'm surprised nobody else that has rated this noticed the noise at night after a long day travelling from the massive fans that are around the outside buildings like the noise of 3 planes all night long. Second night just got to bed at 11 to be woken up by apartment next door partying although there is a no party policy (yeah right) and the security guards trying to remove them which took till after 1.30 the yelling and shouting kept us awake. Then the third night another group of people upstairs stayed up all night yelling and banging (no protection from noise from floor to floor or wall to wall. The reception people were less than friendly one lady who checked us in was the only one with a personality and was decent. On checking out wasn't even asked how the stay was although I didn get a whole $85 off because of the noise with the Security- should have been the whole night.
