On Saturday night after being out for dinner arrived back at 11pm only to find the parking downstairs had been locked and showed signs of Full. We took 15mins to find the Public Car Park and had to walk about 15mins through a horrible carpark to get back to the apartment lifts. Not good enough when you are paying that you can't get into a carpark. Shocking experience not recommended for the price. Beds are all like rocks.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place to stay if you get a good deal!”
Reviews.Author: iloveholidays077
Reviews.Content: We managed to get our stay at World tower for $300 per night for a 3 bed/2 bath. This is wonderful value. It is in a great location, near shops, Darling Harbour and Paddy's Markets. The apartments are well finished off and have everything you could need for a self catering stay. We all enjoyed the views and my teenagers enjoyed using the gym and pool. We would definitely stay again, if we got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “excellent, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: mzfinah
Reviews.Content: arrived at the hotel at 11pm staff were friendly and organized our late check in very quickly. had a room on the 74th floor and an amazing room! 3 bed rooms all with amazing views of sydney. large living room and kitchen, also had own laundry within the apartment, extreamly helpful especially with a partner who has sensitive skiin! staff were very accommodating and extremely helpful! went out of the way to say hello in the morning and make sure you have a good time. swimming pool and spa really good and spacious. i would recommend this to a friend however it is overpriced, the view is great but you get over it quickly, especially when you only stay a weekend. great location the monorail is literally next door! there is a shopping centre and coles directly next door and open til late! great night light on Pitt street and lots of shops open til late.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star accommodation at four star prices”
Reviews.Author: stargazer43
Reviews.Content: Our initial goal was to stay again at the Shangri La hotel with harbour facing corner rooms overlooking the Sydney Opera House and Sydney Harbour bridge. Fantastic views and a great hotel at prohibitive prices. Due to being fully booked over Christmas and New Year we looked around & were lucky enough to find the Meriton World Tower offering spectacular views and large luxury accommodation at a fraction of the price we had originally budgeted. We had a three bedroomed apartment which, as others have mentioned, can easily house six people with room to spare. The master bedroom is set slightly apart from the other two bedrooms. Enough to give a degree of additional privacy without being too far if one has young children. There is a large open plan living area with a modern kitchen and a separate laundry room. Everything you could want is provided for within the apartment and there is a nice pool and limited gym for those who want some recreation. There is a handy supermarket within the building complex if you are looking to self cater, good cafes (literally outside the front entrance) and many various restaurants offering a plethora of cuisines to suit all taste buds. The mono rail is literally next door and taxis outside are plentiful. The location of the Meriton World Tower whilst not on the waterfront is excellent as there is easy access to the shopping district, parks, museums and other attractions. Parking in the basement is available in limited supply at Aus$35/day and Avis is round the corner in Pitt Street if you want to hire a car. What are the negatives? Whilst Meriton has sister apartments close by with balconys, World Tower now has none. This means you are mainly dealing with canned air and many people do report/comment on feeling claustrophobic after a while with a need to 'get out'. I was amazed at how many times I overheard people talking about this in the lift and lobby. If you are a smoker it means having to go down 60+ floors to get out. If you have small children not having a balcony is probably a source of relief. There are three lifts serving all the floors and they are 'card activated'. No card, no activation i.e you are stuck. The service is slow and the lifts are not programmed for optimised running. This results in long queues of people getting increasingly grumpy at peak times. There are normally one or two staff at the front desk and whilst most of them do try to do their best it is here that the difference between a top hotel and Meriton is most apparent. The two staff members are supposed to cover all the functions of reception, concierge and bell boy and clearly cannot cope despite their best endeavours. This can lead to long queues waiting to check in or out and if one of the two on duty is helping guests put their suitcases in the 'lock up room' it can mean a fifteen minute plus wait. Check out is 10 am. Check in 2pm. So if you arrive on an early flight it can be galling to have to wait four to five hours before being able to get into your apartment. Subject to availability late check out can be arranged for a very reasonable charge. The internet service for booking and responding is first class. Crisp and efficient. All in all, the old saying of 'You get what you pay for' is a truism here. Great accommodation, location & views at a great price. The trade off? All the issues mentioned. For us they were worthwhile concessions

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities and worlds lousiest service and attitude provided by surly folks!”
Reviews.Author: BangkokDaniel
Reviews.Content: We had 3 Apartments on the 68th floor from the 29th of November through December 10th 2010. Booked through our local contact that uses Meriton often and gives them in excess of 350 room nights per annum. Our Apartments were not ready until 14:00 which is their normal check in time but hard when you arrive at 08:30 after a 9 1/2 hour flight. The staff were not sympathetic or tried to expedite the cleaning. Once we took possession of our Apartments we can only say great stuff, great views and superb furnishings but the crux is in the details.These are of no concern to anyone of the mostly incompetent staff. The problems already starts with actual technical set up" One air con control for all 3 bedrooms? Which non thinking person thought of that? Only 4 elevators to service the Serviced Apartments? The wait in the morning and in the evening was up to 12 minutes just to get an elevator???? Unacceptable for this price. The hanger fixtures were facing the wrong way to the hole where you had to tread the hangar through in order to take the hangar out of the wardrobe were all facing the wrong way. Not a big issue but it shows the level of care that the staff who ran this place put in to it- none whatsover. The poor cleaning staff seem to be generally overburdned and under equipped! Nobody seemed to have taught them hhow to clean where to start and where to end and what to bring nor supply them with a sufficient amount of carts so that they could carry everything the needed to clean a Apartment. They hand carried sheets and towels like in a one star place and had small metal supermarket baskets for their provisions. All looked and felt very unprofessional. Mirrors left behind with streaks in it and stains on the fridge door remained there for the entire stay. The pool was supposed to be heated but actually ice cold. Beer could have been chilled sufficiently in this heated pool. One day the fitness room did not open at the time it was supposed to and according to a staffer because of heavy drinking by customers and staff the night before in the recreation area??? Oh boy real 5 star. The hammer is the uncaring and downright unfriendly reception staff. They are both incompetent and try to disguise it behind a so called professional look that is just plain rude. You know when you are in trouble, when in a place the security guards are friendlier then the reception staff, i.e. world tower. The only saving grace of the reception was David, a cheerful and happy lad that actually cared about people and in honest provided a great service. Regretfully he was not working every day but his colleagues should pay attention to him and copy him, that would make World tower a much better place. Our Air con in the master bedroom did not work for the entire stay. The first night a technician came and went with no results. The 2nd night David offered us a fan which brought some relief or to move. But moving after having settled in was not an option. He promised a repair service. Upon following up three timed during the next day I found out that the manager knew about the defective air con as they had scheduled as professional service to come in and fix it in 7 days! Why they placed us in that apartment in the first place then? Well to make it short they claimed the customer before you did not complain! Regardless if you know you have a problem you do not let a customer check in and make them suffer. As they could read in any basic service marekting text most customers do not complain they just do not comeback- a fact lost on these incompetent people. Messages were another real stinger. The phone has a voice mail function and blinks every minute for once or twice with a tiny red light-which of course nobody sees as the phone is located in a remote corner of the living room where nobody normally goes. When messages were manually taken they were not delivered and I was even lied to with the statement ,, we do not take messages" but later this statement became a lie as we were able to proof who took the manual message that we never got. You think they would say sorry or our apologies? Never came across their lips. When my key card malfunctioned twice and I had to get it re programmed again you guessed right- no apologies offered. What is a great pity is that someone actually invested in world class facilties that are totally miss managed. I feel sorry for the owner and the future customers. I suggest to have a specialist go through these facilities with a fine comb and tweak and fine tune all physical faciltiy aspects. As for the staff with the exception of david they should be sent to work for the competition and new staff properly trained in providing caring and friendly and customer focused service. Until then I will not return and do my part to warn future customers as much as I can of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Group Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: rbtravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of friends for a girls night in the city. The room was a little pricy (we had a 3 bedroom apartment) but when we divided the cost between the 6 of us it was fairly resonable. The apartment was absolutley spotless, all appliances and furnishings appeared new and the apartment had a great view. Hotel is excellently located above World square so close to a Coles Supermarket which was handy, and it's just off George Street so it was really easy to get a cab, and was within walking distance of several good night clubs. 5 star hotel for sure, but has a very corporate feel, not the lush kind of 5 star. But i'd highly recomend it for a city night or family/group stay

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family”
Reviews.Author: Kilat_Goby
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3-bedroom apartment which was absolutely perfect for our busy extended family. There was space for everyone without tripping over each other, and all the facilities and fittings were high quality. The basement has a shopping centre with supermarket which is extremely convenient. We all loved the swimming pool with its great views of the city. There's a monorail station next door which whisks you to various tourist spots, and the free city shuttle bus stops nearby also. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and views but terrible beds”
Reviews.Author: melbrne_girl
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised that a hotel which charges nearly 300 dollars a night for a 3-bedroom apartment could not provide better beds. We spent the worst night on a mattress hard as a rock and springs poking into our backs. I tried sleeping on the couch but couldn't find an extra blanket. The hotel location is great but what good are the views when you are bleary eyed from a sleepless night? The reception staff were discourteous and blase, reclining in their desk chairs as if they were sitting on a couch at home. A disappointing experience to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, awful bed”
Reviews.Author: csmart
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 23 nights while on a business trip to Sydney. My apartment was a 2 bedroom on the 65th floor with great views. The apartment itself was very spacious and perfectly laid out. The only gripes were the bed which was the hardest I've ever slept in, making for a restless nights sleep; spent a lot of time waiting for lifts; and there were renovations going on which were a right pain in the backside when trying to work. I would however stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Unprofessional Staff”
Reviews.Author: AraleMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Meriton World Tower a number of times. My experience is that if you do not want to be upset don't interact with the front desk staff. We called first thing in the morning to book a maxi-cab to the airport as we had 5 adults and 3 young children. We ensured that they knew we needed 3 car seats and to collect us at 4pm. We were told there will be no issues with that. Come 3.50pm we stood outside the main doors waiting, waited 25 mins before going back to the front desk to ask when the taxi is coming. It was then that we were told there is no guarantee on the cabs coming. We were surprised and asked what "booking a cab" meant if there is no guarantee. The receptionist simply answered with "we have refreshed your booking". When we asked her what she meant once again, she avoided our question and said "All the bookings today have turned up so there is no reason to suspect that the cab will not come". She is so illogical - so all the bookings turned up, ours haven't yet but there is no reason to suspect even though there is no guarantee? Was there other bookings for 5 adults and 3 car seats for 3 young children? There's a huge difference between a normal cab and a maxi-cab! What we wanted her to understand was that she should have told us in the first place that there is no guarantee, we have a flight to catch. But this receptionist not only did not apologise she even avoided our questions by answering with things that have no relevance to what we were asking. Needless to say we were appalled by such unprofessional customer service! Secondly, the cleaning staff do the bare minimum. They do not replace sufficient towels, they do not clean the toilets or empty out the bins and they even left a bag of other people's rubbish on our kitchen top!!! Seriously unprofessional once again. All in all the location is great, the room is spacious but Meriton needs to rethink its choice of staff. These people are not tried to provide customer service and should therefore not be employed in such capacity!

Reviews.Title: “The worst stay ever”
Reviews.Author: nothappymeriton
Reviews.Content: The sole purpose of our stay was to stay in the penhouse on the 74 floor with my five good girlfriends, an to have a get together with a few friends from 40 to 50 years old, I informed them that it was for my 50th birthday celebration. It was $1050 for the night. The girls starting to arrive from 7.30pm.we were under the understanding that we could have guests to 11pm then there were to leave. We were playing a few quizes when the knock came to the door the security guards said yous are making noice. Then my friends got me a entertainer called Hugh Monro who was doing a dolly parton an tina turner routine at 10pm when the security came again This time very forceful telling us we were being evicted, The entertainer said it was a few songs he had only done a 25 min routine an tried to reason with them no one was drunk, . there is only one penhouse per floor so how could they be too much noice it was only a stereo an singing. This is at 10pm. it broke up our get together as we all left, we didnt get to see the full routine of Hugh's which was a lot of fun... We were not a gang of roudy teenagers we were mature women having a glass of champagne, To say I was dissapointed The meriton want your money then leave that as far as I can make out . We told the security that only 6 were staying an they counted us like children when we came back. I felt I was back at the convent with the nuns. How dare yous treat me like this on my 50th Birthday... I am a Restaurant owner myself, an I definately wouldnt recommend the Meriton Penhouse to anyone for a group of 15 people. Please read this well... I am no Happy Jan...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: aliali53
Reviews.Content: We had a 2-bedroom/2-bathroom apartment at the World Tower on the 68th floor and it was great. Very spacious, well-equipped, clean, quiet, fabulous views. Swimming pool on the 61st floor as well, with spa pool and gym. If I had to criticise something (and I am struggling here!) it would be that the King bed was two singles joined together - that lump in the middle where the beds are joined is not comfortable!!! It was a busy weekend and people were a bit noisy in the corridors as we were close to the lifts but I certainly wasn't kept awake by parties or the like. Would most definitely stay here again. Just a couple of steps up the road to the monorail station and a few steps down the road to Coles supermarket and a variety of other handy shops for families. I paid AU$225 through the conference that I attended whihc was good I thought for a 5-star, large apartment in a great location with great views.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location and service”
Reviews.Author: Cannotpacklight
Reviews.Content: This is a great apartment complex. The location is fantastic and the services availahle downstairs at the World Square complex are terrific - an enormous supermarket with everything you could possibly desire, plus good t/a food options (sushi, Indian, dumplings etc etc). The service from the front desk is good, and the housekeeping staff are obliging and do a good job with the daily service. The parking is a breeze - you can enter and exit as many times during a 24hr period as you like, and then you just pay a daily rate. You can even get your car washed in the carpark! The apartments are nicely decorated, and view is unbelievable. The indoor pool has a great view over the city. You can use internet/computer downstairs in the lobby for some minimal fee. We had read about problems with the lifts but didn't find it an issue. This is a great way to experience Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “It feels like floating on top of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: rram_n
Reviews.Content: First things first...each apartment is bound to have amazing views. As this building towers over the ones nearby, you can get an unrestricted view, as far as the eye can see... It's centrally located in Sydney CBD and all the popular Sydney attractions are a short walk away. It took us about 30 minutes to walk down to the Opera House from the hotel. The staff were friendly as well. Staying here is much better than staying at a hotel in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Superb apartment with amazing location and view!”
Reviews.Author: ALW222
Reviews.Content: We loved this apartment from the moment we walked in. We were on the 65th floor and the view was amazing. The apartment was very clean and well serviced and had everything we needed for our 3 night stay. The station for the monorail being just outside was an added bonus. Sydney is a beautiful city and this is the perfect place to stay and explore this interesting city. Would definately recommend these apartments.

Reviews.Title: “A world above the rest”
Reviews.Author: Kyles_and_Harmen
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here after a cruise we'd completed and found this place to be great. Very clean amd spacious. The amenities were fantastic. The view is great. I couldn't really fault this place. Yes the elevators were a little slow but who cares. I loved the location, right above lots of restaurants and a coles too. Definitely staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE SYDNEY AND THE VIEW FROM M W T IS TRULY AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: MORROCOMRS
Reviews.Content: We had an international flight to catch the following morning and so checked out adult family into a 3 bedroom apartment in the Meriton World Tower. Wow!! It was amazing. Easy parking underneath, modern and sooo spacious apartment it was the perfect pre accommodation for our families first big overseas holiday. Ordered pizza to be delivered as we didnt want to go anywhere. The view was spectacular on the 72nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Sydney Views by Day and be dazzled by Sydney Lights at Night”
Reviews.Author: SweetChocolate65
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 67th floor of the Meriton World Tower and from the moment you walk in the door you are drawn to the floor to ceiling windows to gaze at the view!! We were fortunate to be overlooking Darling Harbour and beyond. The view was beautiful by day and dazzling by night. Breath-taking! The 2 bedroom apartment was spacious and clean - 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, well-laid out kitchen and even a separate laundry. There were plenty of lifts and the wait for a lift to arrive was short. The staff were extremely helpful and polite. We found the apartment clean and well-serviced. The location was brilliant - the monorail was just downstairs and only a short walk to Town Hall station. Our teenage sons enjoyed the gym, pool and spa - once again the views from this floor were fabulous. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view - sleeping over Sydney downtown”
Reviews.Author: coasty1970
Reviews.Content: It's really an event to sleep in the 68th floor and go swimming in 64th floor with a great view over Sydney downtown. The hotel offers cheap rates for appartmentsm so it's really not expensive, especially if you go there with a group of friends!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable view”
Reviews.Author: Tara51
Reviews.Content: 7 of us stayed in the one apartment...it was HUGE...so much space. The views of Sydney were fantastic. Well equiped kitchen,washing machine and dryer,iron etc. When you get downstairs you are in the middle of the busy city. Cafes, bars, restaurants everywhere. Monorail is right next door..so handy for getting to lots of tourist spots. Our kids had a ball exploring the city then back to the apartment for swimming indoors and a spa!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: cantfindthewords
Reviews.Content: Best accomadation in Sydney City. Great location and most of all great rooms :) I have stayed here time and time again and wanted to make the effort to rate these apartments. Fabulous views with an incredibly spacious room. Possibly the best place I have ever stayed. Cannot pin point one fault. These apartments will not dissapoint. If you have the extra cash be sure to stay in a three bedroom and request a high room. You really dont want to leave the apartment. Views are spectacular :)

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: HellonBrissie
Reviews.Content: I have just had the pleasure of a four night stay in the Meriton World Tower in Sydney. I took advantage of a special May mayhem rate and was lucky enough to secure a 3 bedroom apartment. As this was prepaid I was a bit nervous about the whole experience. I have to say though it was the best experience ever - I was celebrating my 50th birthday with husband and relatives. The views were absolutely wonderful - apartment huge and I could not have asked for more. The unit was on the 75th floor and spectacular Staff were very courteous and very helpful. We had a bit of plumbing problem on the second day and without hesitation we were moved to another apartment - the sub penthouse on the 77th floor. This was not a problem at all. I would highly recommend the Meriton - have stayed in Meriton in Pitt Street last year and found both apartments wonderful but the views in the World Tower are well and truly worth the monies spent. Well situated - close to everything!!! I would not have a problem recommending the Meriton World Tower. Excellent accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Star and teenage parties every night - huge dissapointment!”
Reviews.Author: djhm
Reviews.Content: The location and views were excellent but the accommodation was 4 star at best. Even staying on the 71st floor was actually only 61st because (deceptively) they call the ground floor 10!!! Highly over priced and what about the air conditioning that was pre-set to work for a maximum of 4 hours at a time? To keep the rooms cool required someone to wake during the night and re-set the air conditioning switch!!!!! The site has a STRICT no party policy and the reception area was full of security guards every night - a bit like a night club entrance. Not sure what the purpose of the guards was because EVERY NIGHT there were common areas full of noisy, foul mouthed, partying teenagers and defense force people.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: cargo999
Reviews.Content: 6 of us (husband, me and 4 teenagers) stayed here for 1 week. It was fantastic! Spacious, comfortable, good kitchen facilities, good service, fantastic views, close to everything and it was good value compared to having to book 3 rooms at a hotel and then eat out for every meal. I wanted to stay there permanently but alas ... we eventually had to return home! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great, central location, friendly staff, awesome views”
Reviews.Author: PippinCat
Reviews.Content: I was one of four women out for St Patrick's Day night away and we booked a two-bedroom apartment, four x single beds, two bathrooms, kitchen, etc. Found we were on the 66th floor facing west. The view was awesome but just a little too much for someone with a fear of heights! The room was very spacious, the hotel location literally 10 minutes' walk from Chinatown, Cockle Bay Wharf, Harbourside, and only seconds to George Street. There was plenty of room to relax with a separate lounge and 'balcony' which i simply couldn't walk onto. It was perfect for overnight with friends, and would be great for families visiting the big smoke.

Reviews.Title: “360 Degree view of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Sydney_M
Reviews.Content: If you want the best views of sydney the Mertion World Towers will give you that! The staff are okay , service is pretty good. The location is quite central, we always find great rates online. The rooms are quite spacious and clean. just keep the noise down they dont tend to like that.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and apartment for families with children, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: travelyear001
Reviews.Content: I'm on the fence about whether to recommend this lodging. Overall we were satisfied with the two-bedroom apartment we rented for 10 days. The location is very convenient for families -- there's a good-quality grocery store in the shopping mall at the base of the tower, and Darling Harbour, with its great playground, is just down the street. The layout and features of the apartment are quite nice (e.g. high quality washer/dryer and kitchen appliances) and the views are wonderful. My main complaint about the World Tower atmosphere is that it's so sterile and impersonal -- there is virtually no service and no special decor or personal touches to it -- and it's usually crowded since they do a high volume business. The fitness center epitomizes the style of the building: great view, but basic equipment with virtually no amenities (for example, no towels to wipe down equipment, no remote control to change the TV channel). We also did not like how crowded the lobby and elevators always seemed to be, and the crowd tends to be younger and inclined to partying (even though there are "No Parties Allowed" signs everywhere). The value is good for the weekdays but they jack up the rates on weekends. All in all, this apartment worked well for us, but after 10 days we felt as though we had been sleeping in a high-rise box for too long. I'd have to conclude I probably would not recommend it for friends; I think we could have done better. For more recommendations on Sydney activities for families, please see our blog post http://away-together.com/2010/02/11/sydney-wet-and-wild/

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous apartments, awesome views of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Abesontour
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 7602 (floor 76) in 2 bed apartment. Apartment itself was huge, clean, modern kitchen with the correct amount of crockery and cutlery. Two very spacious bedrooms with the main one having two large mirrored wardrobes, with FREE safe, and en-suite (with his and her sinks) with shower and jacuzzi bath. Plenty of very fast lifts and always available seeing that the Meriton was fully booked. Reception staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. Rooms tidied daily and beds/towels changed regularly. Tea, coffee, wash up and laundry liquid provided daily. Our corner plot of 76th floor had an awesome view of South Sydney and Darling Harbour, the lounge and bedrooms have floor to ceiling windows. Also the view from the pool & gym (61st floor) was just as amazing.Centrally located for all major Sydney attractions, inc. China Town, and transport links. It's 40 mins from Sydney International and 30 mins Sydney Domestic ($45 & $30 taxi fare respectively). Not cheap for us at Â£170 a night but if four adults split the cost it's a bargain, the views are worth Â£200 a night alone, especially as it goes dusk and Sydney lights up before your eyes!! If you don't want the views try one of the other Meritons as they are cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Value for $ when sharing”
Reviews.Author: MaisyPortMacquarie
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay here or at the Kent St, Meriton. Value for $ when sharing. close to the CBD for work/meetings/shopping. 15 Walk to Darling Harbour or a short Monorail ride. I have only stayed in the 3 bedroom appartments, they all have been very clean, modern. with a variety of views depending on what side of the building you are located. Floor to ceiling windows give you a spectacular view of the city lights. Coles and speciality shops located beneath building, easy access.

Reviews.Title: “Great loaction - book on budget website - fanatsic stay”
Reviews.Author: Aussie8888
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here numerous times over the years in the three bedroom suites and recommend it highly. Book through discount sites as their price is better. The view is spectacular and a short walk to all shops, Darling Harbour, Chinatown etc. The staff have always been great and assistance for any issues is quick.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: advocate_of_truth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for my birthday. I was honestly quite surprised with this hotel. I was upgraded to a 3 bedroom apartment on the 76th floor. The room was amazing! Huge. My room alone was the size of a standard hotel room. The kitchen was great. The bathroom was huge. The view was spectacular! We had literally 360 degree views of the city. It was beautiful! Pros: Great value Located in the centre of the city Spacious rooms Quiet great views Cons: Service would have been more friendlier

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment - amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: Dev0nb0y
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2-bedrooom apartment for 3 weeknights in November 09 with my wife and our friend. Settled on the Meriton after looking at various Sydney hotels and finding we'd get far more for our money going for a serviced apartment. At their standard midweek advance rate of $200/night, this was a good value for 3 of us; if we'd shared the cost between 4 it'd have been a real steal. Reception staff efficient if not overly charismatic. Living area in the apartment was huge - vastly more space than we'd have got for the same money in a hotel. Kitchen pretty well-equipped, though being right on the edge of Chinatown we ate out every night anyway! (Try the home-made noodles at the Sea Bay Restaurant just around the corner: it doesn't look like anything much from the outside but when you can get a delicious, filling meal for about $12, who's complaining?) Views from the balcony (indoors - we were on the 55th floor) are amazing - as long as you're not hoping to see the Opera House or Harbour Bridge! We spent quite some time just sitting drinking wine and watching the city at night. The beds were comfortable enough - no better or worse than the generality of hotel beds, anyway. The whole apartment was pretty much spotless, and the cleaning staff put the dishwasher on each day with all the stuff (glasses, mainly) that we'd lazily left sitting around. The swimming pool is definitely worth a visit, if only for the novelty of a 50th-floor view whilst swimming. Only encountered the much-documented lift problem once during our stay - just make sure that if you're on a tight schedule you leave an extra 15 minutes just in case. Location, while a bit off-centre, suited us just fine - it's a lively area, and there's plenty of bars, restaurants and handy shops nearby (try some cakes from Chinese patisserie 81 Degrees). Circular Quay is walkable - take the route through park and the Botanic Garndens - or the train station is just couple of blocks away. We had an evening flight going back, and staff looked after our bags on the last day for no extra charge. Overall, I would highly recommend the Meriton World Tower (except, maybe on the much more expensive Friday and Saturday nights). It'd be good for a romantic break, for a family or for a group of friends. Just leave extra time for the lifts and if you especially value a view of Circular Quay, look elsewhere! But for the money, I'd say this'd be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding apartment, views and location”
Reviews.Author: MagFamily
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place to stay. Would recommend booking direct with Meriton for best price. Really spacious 3 bedroom apartment for family of 6. Couldn't have got better value for money. Having the supermarket below in World tower shops makes an even better venue with a family. Will definately stay again with family.

Reviews.Title: “A marvelous stay”
Reviews.Author: ktvids
Reviews.Content: We were trying to find a city location that was accessable to local transport and also offered nice veiws. This place had it all. We had a two bedroom apartment so we could put our 4 yo to bed at a reasonable time, whilst giving us some grown up time together. The place was amazing! We were on the 70th floor with breathtaking views of the harbour and eastern suburbs. The staff were excellent and were able to organise a stroller for our young one in less than 3 hours (saved my neck from carrying her around) and at a good price. It is a good 1.5 kms from Circular Key (ferries), however there is a free bus (number 555) that picks up and puts down less than 100 metres from the hotel. Also there is a monorail that does the majority of the tourist venues which is literally right outside the foyer. All this forAU$180 a night (mid week, off peak). We loved the place and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views, spacious room, great location”
Reviews.Author: rob51290
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our 2 year anniversary. Managed to pick the room up cheaply by monitoring the booking sites. I reccomend you do so also about a month and a half preceding the trip. Staff were welcoming but not smothering. It was pleasing because i was a little anxious/nervous about spending all this money and not wanting to agree to something i couldnt afford. Staff didnt offer anything - just made themselves available to requests. Pool on level 61 is breathtaking. Lovely panoramic views of the northern half of the city. Our room (2 bd apartment) was more than we needed for the two of us. We remarked that it would be an excellent place to have a hens/bucks night in the city. Would be quite affordable for half a dozen people. We couldnt get a taxi quite out the front. That said, it was prime time for dinner so they were quite busy. Only had to cross the street to George st to get a cab. Couldnt fault the room, great kitchen. 2 large bathrooms. The main ensuite had a BIG bath (large enough for both of us to fit, and we are 6'4" and 5'10"). Couldnt get over the view of Darling Harbour - that we requested! Wonderful. Summary - immaculate accomodation, available but not persisten service. Thankyou meriton!

Reviews.Title: “Meriton”
Reviews.Author: DeviJayy
Reviews.Content: My mum and I got a discounted price of $200 per night at Meriton Hotel so we stayed over at a one bedroom apartment for 2 days and 1 night. The facility was pretty decent for a one bedroom apartment. They also had a nice spa and swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views, central location + large serviced apartment”
Reviews.Author: KosBoy
Reviews.Content: High-rise accommodation in a famous landmark Sydney skyscraper. Floor to ceiling windows offer exceptional panoramic views of Darling Harbour, the Heads and South East Suburbs (depending on your apartment's orientation). Apartments are modern and roomy. Location is superb, in the heart of the city. Restaurants, pubs, clubs, shops (QVB) and supermarket at your door step. Monorail at your door step. Train stations only minutes away (Town Hall and Museum). Recommended: For families, couples and large groups (we were in a 12 man tour, booked 2 Penthouses).....this place is most suitable. Likes: 1. Location (central), close to everything 2. Panoramic views 3. Quick and easy access to Monorail and Train Stations 3. Pool (1.2m), spa and sauna on Level 61 4. Modern, spacious and very clean...also very quiet apartments (even the air con is quiet) 5. Foxtel + DVD player Dislikes: 1. Shortage of cutlery, dishwasher liquid, toilet paper etc....penny pinching for what is charged 2. Only 3 security keys provided to share amongst 6 person room 3. Expensive internet access (just wish Australia follows Asias lead and offers free internet access, especially when you're paying top dollar) 4. Size of TV / Plasma...should have been larger given the size of the apartment 5. Very small gym.....plus spa and pool could have been larger

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular! Great View & Spacious room”
Reviews.Author: loveJP
Reviews.Content: we got the 3-bedroom apt. on 70th floor. i was really nice. the kitchen facilities were new and clean. the rooms(bed & living) were clean. the living room was large. the location was superb.... supermarkets and shops and restaurants just below the bldg. the only thing is there is no concierge or bell service - so basically had to hull our luggage up & down ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: danthegirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meriton Towers in a two bedroom two bathroom apartment on 62nd floor to see in the New Year. We stayed for four days in total. My sons keep reminding me how lush the apartment was and it really was. We took full advantage of the pool and the facilities close by. If you like sushimi, there are at least ten or so very well patronised sushi bars close by. Being right above a late opening Coles meant that it was easy to buy food to cook in the apartment, saving a wad in take aways and restaurants. I think its important to remember that this was a serviced apartment rather than a hotel so the service expectation really isn't the same. Our unit was very clean and spacious and we were able to get extra towels and cleaning agents etc when asked. Our view was pure luck but we had a full view of the fireworks on the coat hanger between the buildings and an uninterupted view of the barge on Darling Harbour. We could also see the ships as they travelled alight along Sydney Harbour. So our NYE in Sydney was amazing - an experience we won't forget for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Wow!”
Reviews.Author: beckyjon
Reviews.Content: I checked for months before travelling to Australia on tripadvisor for reviews of these apartments and was slightly concerned with the comments about how unhelpful the front of house staff were. I needn't have worried, we arrived after an early morning arrival 6.30 am, and arrived at the Meriton at 7.30 am as they were full the night before our apartment wasn't ready, which wasn't surprising seeing as check in was 2pm. We left our luggage in a locked room and were directed to a coffee shop nearby. We had breakfast and went back at 9 am. The lady on the desk told us our aparment was ready! We went up to the 72nd floor and into our large spacious, clean apartment. Oh Wow! The views across Sydney were amazing! We could see across Sydney Harbour and at night the views were even more breathtaking. We had a 3 bedroomed apartment which was brill! We had absolutely no complaints about anything. Coles supermarket is under the building and in the near vicinity was the mono rail, the train station, the free bus to Circular Quay, shops, bars and restaurants. The pool on level 61 was great, brill views. We loved everything and didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spacious apartment with fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: travellinman2009
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in this very spacious, high quality apartment with really incredible views over Sydney. Everything was top quality and the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. We would have been happy to stay much longer.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Views in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: jaffajames
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here with my Parents, Husband & 4 year old. What an awsome apartment on the 75 floor. So big & clean. The views over Sydney were the best I dont think we closed the curtains at all! The location is great with Darling Harbour, Chinatown right at your door & a Coles Supermarket underneath. The monorail stops right at your door. Will be staying again if we get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Suzetheraveller
Reviews.Content: Excellent views, huge apartments, well appointed, great location. Hotel services (cleaning) staff were helpful and friendly. The only minor complaints we had were: * dishwasher did not work well which is surprising given it was a Miele. We called for service on three occassions and it seemed no one really knew anything about the appliance. Better routine maintenance might improve this. * in house movies didn't work. It took four visits until resolved which was at the end of our stay. * front desk staff were in general unhelpful. * we checked out on the day of the city to surf fun run and due to the difficulty in getting to the hire car we were picking up due to road closures we asked for a late check out to 12 midday when the roads opened up again. It was going to cost $50/hour to secure this late check out. This seemed unreasonable. Even given these small complaints, we would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent View”
Reviews.Author: NLovejoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a 2 bedroom apartment in April on a 60 something floor, the views are great, location is also good. We have no complaints and would return.

Reviews.Title: “What a view, what a location.”
Reviews.Author: travellingrat
Reviews.Content: I booked a two bedroom appartment several months out from travelling. We were in Sydney to celebrate my wifes 40th birthday with another couple, and wanted somewhere up market, reasonable and near the centre of town. This place met all our requirements, and then some! We were lucky enough to be on the top floor and the view was breathtaking! Appartment was very spacious, rooms were a good size, large lounge area. Bathrooms were great. I did get a fright one morning when a cockroach ran over my foot, but I can live with that, it wasn't a spider. Cleaning staff were friendly and efficient. The no-party policy was being abused on our floor, but we could only hear them in the lobby outside the lift. All was quiet in the room. We had a taxi rank out the front, and no trouble getting a ride. Great shopping really close by too. Totally recommend this place, we LOVED it.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: SJBLimerick
Reviews.Content: What a place to stay,just brilliant.We were here for two nights,in a room on the 66 floor.The view was amazing,everything is so small down there!!!The kids loved the pool,us adults just sat in the jacuzi and admired Sydney.Our room was huge,so much space for the four of us.It was also clean,something others had complained about.The washing machine and tumble dryer were put to good use.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: meganbm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. Booked only 24 hours in advance, and managed to bag a great deal. Fantastic apartment, great views over darling harbour, so close to all amenities and city centre. Plenty to do. Would definately recommend to others and will definately be back again.!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family accommodation”
Reviews.Author: ajfNZ
Reviews.Content: We are a family with a young child and stayed in a two bedroom apartment at the Meriton World Tower for five nights in June/July 2009. When on holiday we always look for accommodation in an excellent location with large spacious rooms, a full kitchen to make catering for our three year old daughter easy, laundry access, good facilities including a heated lap pool and a nice outlook. The Meriton World Tower did not disappoint. In fact, having read some of the recent tripadvisor reviews the standard of the accommodation was a really pleasant surprise and it contributed to a brilliant family holiday. We found the building to be in a great location. We took a stroller for our daughter and walked everywhere within the central city between Darling Harbour and Circular Quay. The apartment we stayed in was on the 76th floor and had magnificent views over the airport, Darling Harbour and North West Sydney. It consisted of two very generous bedrooms (one with ensuite including spa bath), a large living area, a well appointed kitchen, laundry with washer and drier and a separate bathroom. The facilities included a functional fitness room, a fantastic two lane 20 metre lap pool that was very well designed and had no rebound wave effect, a good sized spa and a sauna. The pool/sauna area was on the 61st floor with floor to ceiling windows creating a spectacular setting. We want to make an important point regarding the service. A number of the earleir reviewers have commented on the poor service they received. We received friendly and helpful assistance from the reception staff particularly Tim who was extremely obliging. Our room was given a "light" service daily - vaccuming was done, dishes put away, rubbish removed, beds made and new towels provided and we considered it more than sufficient. It needs to be remembered that the accommodation is a serviced apartment building and the tariff really covers the large spaces, amenities and facilities that are provided. It is therefore quite unfair to compare the service with that you might expect at four and five star hotels. As a couple we would still choose to stay in one of Sydney's gorgeous hotels but as a family we do not think we could beat the Meriton World Tower.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic views - superb”
Reviews.Author: paras108
Reviews.Content: if u book a 2 or 3 bedroom apt u get a room on the 61st floor onwards - the view is unbelievable and the apt is very very spacious. all amenities are included. the reception staff are a bit slow to respond and the lifts can become a bit crowded due to many people staying. location is good with the monorail next door. supermarkets and other stores are just beneath the apt. cbd and clarke quay are all walking distance. cleaning is done every alternate day only. but just to re-iterate the view is unbelievable. you can sit and gaze out of the large full lenght windows for a long time. rates keep on varying and so better book in advance- the rates peak on friday and saturday and fall back on sunday. have stayed 3 times at this place. kitchen is also well equipped and there is washing machine and dryer in each apt

Reviews.Title: “Great View the rest not so great”
Reviews.Author: soo_what
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Meriton early June 2009 for four nights have stayed on previous times with no real dramas. This time our first room was dirty main bedroom had heavily stained beds including matress and pillow 2nd bedroom had what looked like some kind of bug in the bed very hard to even think about getting into bed.Carpets dirty clearly not cleaned even though the cleaners were still in the room as we checked in. After being allowed to change room beds slightly cleaner but still clearly not a clean hotel. Having stayed at The Mertion before I was very disappointed at the hotel this time. I will be looking else where for a different hotel next time. Hotel does have a good location with coles close by

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large rooms, but VERY poor service.”
Reviews.Author: feeev
Reviews.Content: Meriton World Tower is located in the heart of the city with restaurants and bars just around the corner. The rooms are very spacious and fairly clean. If you're lucky, the views from the higher floors are spectacular. Although there is also no room service at this hotel, you are provided with menus from nearby restaurants that deliver straight to your room (free delivery for orders over a certain amount). There is also a pool/spa and sauna with great views overlooking the city. However, despite all of this, I will not be returning to this hotel. I am extremely appalled by the service and staff of this hotel. The staff are very rude and unfriendly - the security guards of this hotel are the absolute worst. After a certain time at night, it is run by security and not management. They absolutely have no respect for its guests and act like a bunch of animals. I know this experience has been shared by many others and Meriton World Tower needs to clean up its act. If you're just looking for a place to stay and have no interest in the service the hotel provides, this will be a place for you. However I was highly disappointed and disgusted with the treatment and service I was given and will definitely stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: KrystalDream
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend were looking for accommodation in Sydney for our Australia trip in April, and happened to come across a website which offered an apartment at the Meriton World Tower for only $109! We thought that it must be a fake site and were a little bit hesitant when it came to actually booking, but the site turned out to be real and we actually got it for that price! The site is called check-in.com.au. We stayed in a two bedroom apartment on the 68th floor for three nights. The views are absolutely amazing, but don't expect to get a view over the Sydney Tower or the Opera House, because you probably won't. The hotel was very clean and roomservice was great. Unfortunately no breakfast included in the price. The location of the hotel is very good. It is within walking distance from all the major attractions, and if you're keen on going on the Monorail, there's a stop at Meriton World Tower. The spa bath is to recommend after a long day of being a tourist, or maybe you prefer relaxing in the shared pool with even more amazing views than the room itself! If you feel like you can afford to pay the rates the rooms usually go for, then do it! You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Overall OK, but terrible beds and a timed air conditioner make it hard to have a good night's sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Milliga
Reviews.Content: At first glance, this hotel seems pretty fantastic. We stayed there for three weeks, so definitely got to know the hotel pretty well... Location: A decent location that is pretty central to everything in Sydney. The corner of George and Liverpool is VERY busy especially during peak times. There are no decent restaurants in the immediate area, so you have to go to Darling Harbor or over to the park to get a good meal. If you are taking transit a lot, then go for the weekly (or more) passes they are a great deal compared to the one off fares. Half of the hotel is a residence - mostly a younger crowd that barrels through the lobby without concern for others... (that got old fast) The rooms: The rooms are huge and they have great appliances (all of ours worked). You can't beat having laundry facilities in your room when on a long trip. The biggest and most important downside to the rooms are the beds - they are like cots and so unbelievably uncomfortable that I actually slept on the couch a few nights. This made my stay (and trying to get over the jet lag) very difficult. The every-third-day cleaning is not very good and the bathroom floors are always dirty. The carpets need a good cleaning too. The water pressure is amazing. The views are great (stayed on the 65th floor with the view of Darling Harbor) - I had the view from the other side last time and they are both great. The air conditioner turns off after 3 hours and the room can get VERY toasty - even over night in May when it is cooler. I would always wake up too hot in the middle of the night and have to turn the air conditioner back on. The beds and the air conditioner are enough to keep me away when I return (I will be back for over a month next February). Facilities: The gym is very small (2 treadmills, a couple of other machines and a small weight circuit). The TV is behind the treadmills which is odd. The room has great views, but because it is generally so hot in there(!!!), the windows are usually all steamed up. The pool is a good lap pool. (Great views again). The temperature is good too, not too warm. There's a hot tub and sauna too. Lastly, if you are travelling with others that will have a different room make sure that you are on the same floor. Your "key" only gets you to your floor (and the gym on 61) so you can't visit other floors. (You have to go all the way to the lobby to get "buzzed" up) Bottom line - The beds and timed air conditioner are the deal breaker for me. If that doesn't bug you too much then you might be OK with this choice

Reviews.Title: “Simply stunning- a great retreat for a birthday weekend!!!”
Reviews.Author: TrippinOut00
Reviews.Content: A group of 7 (18-25 yrs old) of us stayed at the World Tower the weekend beginning 18th of April for a sibling's suprise birthday. After reading some of the mixed reviews on this site, I was a little unsure as to whether I made the right decision, however once you enter your apartment all doubts you had are soon forgotten. Checking in was great, we got there about 20 minutes early and our apartment was prepared in about 10 minutes. The staff were delightful (which was surprising considering the reviews on here) and even offered to upgrade our 65th floor 3 bedroom apartment to a 70th floor apartment that was more spacious and had better views ! The apartment itself was quite large and well kept, although I wish there were more couches in the living room considering you could easily fit about 20 people in there. The bedrooms and bathrooms were very clean (all guests in my group are CLEAN FREAKS) and we loved the heated towels!! The kitchen is on the small side but the range of cutlery, appliances and cupboards make up for it. The views are beautiful and were one of the main reasons we didn't want to leave the apartment unless we had to buy food etc. The beds were not the most comfortable but I would say they were decent and the air-conditioning wasn't that bad but I would agree that during summer you might break out in a sweat by simply standing next to the windows! I was quite surprised that we did not experience any sort of loud, annoying guests considering there were about 10 groups of young people who were there for a weekend of clubbing and the fact that the guests in the room next to ours had about 40 people in there having pre-drinks on the Saturday night. The only moment during our stay where we became annoyed was during the night, where the reception staff are off and "security guards" take their place. The guy that was on both those nights was the most rudest and arrogant person I've ever met blaming us for not knowing that guest sofa beds do not come with blankets and that they run out at 10pm. We found out this was a lie upon checking out and the staff were thoughtful enough to refund our $100 for the sofa beds for both nights. I'd highly recommend this hotel for young people, couples and families with older children because when it hits about 10pm the area out front becomes seedy and resembles Kings Cross on a busy Saturday night. It's in a great location- Town Hall station, QVB, Woolworths, Coles, pubs and clubs all within a 10 minute walking distance!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Trombone99Oxford
Reviews.Content: First impressions of the apartments was good. We had a 2 bed apartment on the 65th floor with great views from all rooms. However dishwasher didn't work and the shower door was broken, both reported early in our stay, but neither were repaired during our 8 night stay! Swimming pool was nice with amazing views. Lifts were good, and reception put notices up on the days when they expected them to be busy. If you are looking for a serviced apartment look no further. I think if we visited Sydney again though we would stay in either Darling Harbour or Circular Quay for easier transport links.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: ShopgirlHK
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying in the Meriton World Tower and selected it b/c we are traveling with 3 young kids and needed the space. We have a 3 BR on the 67th floor and have great views of Darling Harbor and can see most of the city, but NOT the Opera House or the Bridge. I did not expect to, so this doesn't bother me. We have a 3 BR which is nice, but this place has no service and nothing works. The dishwasher doesn't work, the shower in the bathroom doesn't work and when we arrived we had to wait 1/2 hour for the keys to work to our place. Light housekeeping is provided daily (garbage out, beds made, and new towels), full housekeeping is every 3rd day. There is no concierge and the lobby is about the most unwelcoming lobby I have ever been in. There is no typical information in the room about the area, etc. Lastly, if I came to Sydney again, I would stay in Circle Quay. The monorail is nice, but it only goes to Darling Harbor. Most everything else we did was either in Circle Quay or a ferry ride from there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Deal For a Great Appartment”
Reviews.Author: Member From Shellharbour Australia
Reviews.Content: We tend to stay in budget to middle level accomodation as a rule, but we got the best deal I have ever had by booking the Meriton World Tower mystery appartment deal on the check-in.com.au site. Availability and conditions may change from time to time. At the moment there is a minimum of a 2 night stay for 2 people and you find out your room type on arrival. But any way you look at it, what a deal !! We got a 2 bedroom appartment for 2 nights on the 65 floor facing East for less than a third of the rack rate. The location and views are fantastic by any standard. The bedrooms are large, the kitchen fully appointed with fridge, freezer, dishwasher, stove etc. There are 2 bathrooms, one with spa bath and towel heater. A clothes washer and dryer round out the appliances. These are serviced appartments so the building does not have the extras that you get in a hotel. But you really dont need them. It is very central, there are many restaurants nearby and on site parking is available (We did not require parking so I cant give any feedback on it). For what we paid, the Meriton World Tower was brilliant!! We probably would not normally have been able to afford to stay here and enjoy such a high standard of accomodation. However, if I was paying full price I would just like to supply the following comments. I would have expected better from a 5 star property on the following items. I agree with some of the other comments that the beds are very hard (and I like a fairly firm bed !) and the pillows are thin and dont support well. I ended up with a bit of a sore neck after 2 nights. As a cost saving measure, the air con turns off after about 4 hours automatically, so you can come back to a warm room or have to get up in the night to re-start it. It can take a while to get a lift at peak periods, and the pool (very small lap pool), gym area was "closed until further notice" what ever that means. If we were to get a similar deal in the future we would definately return, but it would be a treat for us to stay in a place like this with its usual price tag. Bottom line... Yes, improving a few little things would make it a better experience, but it is by no means a bad one as it is. If we paid full price would have rated it a 4 1/2.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms with great views in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: francismcg
Reviews.Content: Our second time at the World Tower (the first being when paying twice the money for half the room over the New Year and still being impressed) and I can't recommend this place enough. We had a two-bedroom suite and it was clean and very spacious and included both a west facing view providing beautiful sunsets and a spa bath big enough for two. The location is excellent with a Coles supermarket almost downstairs and many restaurants nearby with the only drawback that it can become a bit much for families later at night.

Reviews.Title: “No where near a 5 star stay”
Reviews.Author: T-A-UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment with 6 friends for one evening early in Feb. The hotel is relatively easy to find, the access to the parking is not and there is no where to stop out the front and ask instructions. Once inside we were checked in quickly and we surprised by the lack of security in the foyer. People can come and go as they please but you do need a security pass to access the lifts. There was obviously a tour group there as the lobby was full of people milling around at 1130 at night! The layout and views of the room could not be faulted. It was a large amount of space for 6 people and we were very comfortable. The air conditioning however left a lot to be desired as there was no air flow in the rooms and it turned off during the night. The instructions for the air conditioning had been helpfully removed from the guest services folder. Beds were firm but ok. The foxtel in the main room did not flow into the guest rooms. Overall we payed a lot for the view and I would probably not return. The lack of an inbuilt place for breakfast was annoying but when pressed staff reccomended a couple of places.

Reviews.Title: “Huge apartment, amazing view, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Emmaloocoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend and my 10 month old daughter and we loved it. I am planning my next trip back already. The bedrooms were very spacious, gorgeous clean bathrooms, well equiped kitchen and laundry. The living area was huge with the most amazing views over Sydney. This is a serviced apartment so they don't do something that you would expect in a hotel like have a porter or baby cots but they were very quick to help us with the few requests that we did have. Absolutely going back to Sydney and this will be the first place I try to book for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for families in the city”
Reviews.Author: ACAMEX01
Reviews.Content: My family and I took advantage of the views at New Year. We have a 7 month old so couldn't go to the fireworks ourselves. Perfect. Staff were really helpful when we asked for the best view and let us see 3 apartments before we chose one! Can't complain about much, but add to the niggles about cheap equipment (bendy forks, ironing board collapsing under its own weight) and air conditioning. You could do a lot worse and with children I wouldn't consider anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Potential to be exceptional ... but”
Reviews.Author: meplus4
Reviews.Content: The views from the 65 floor are exceptional. We booked a three bed apartment for four adults and two children. The space, especially in the living areas is outstanding. The kitchen has everything you will need. My pet "peeves" were minor but given we stayed a week and paid close to AU$800 per night for four of the seven nights, I feel some of these were justified. The airconditioning turning off every four hours is really annoying especially when it is particularly hot and humid as it was during our stay. The beds and pillows are appalling. I have stayed in caravan parks that had better quality mattresses than the Meriton. Again, for the money you are paying, it wouldn't take much to improve these two (repeatedly complained about) issues. There is a monorail station below the apartment, along with a heap of shops - coles, liquorland etc - all are open quite late. Waiting for lifts can also be a real issue, especially between 8:30 - 10:00 am and again around meal times. We regularly waited up to 20 minutes. Staff were "relatively" helpful - I say relatively because unless you really pumped them for information on the surrounding area/restaurants etc, they didn't go out of their way to volunteer this. The departing invoice is not at all straight forward and when I asked for an explanation, it was given quite reluctantly. My husband has previously stayed at the Meriton in Pitt Street, so perhaps we will try that one next time.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect. Just the aircon timer and hard beds.”
Reviews.Author: MikeyBikey
Reviews.Content: After reading the Tripadvisor reviews I booked a 2-bedroom here for the family via the hotel website. Arrived early, had a fast check-in and they stored my luggage. The reception was nice an efficient. Returned after 2 to get the room key. Also nice and efficient and helped me retreive my luggage. The room is an amazing. We were all amazing at the view, and spent time just standing on the little nook to take it in. The kitchen, baths, and bedrooms were all top notch. Amazing space in a nice, new apartment. The only two nibble (already mentioned here) are the 4 hour timer on the aircon (have to wake up to turn it back on), and the relatively hard beds. But those are just minor quibbles in an amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: PoppetAustralia
Reviews.Content: This provides apartment living in the central CBD. Easy to find. Very spacious rooms with terrific views. Internet available in your room or they have an internet room. Tremendous Gym, did the treadmill overlooking Easter suburbs. Nice pool. Is right beside the monorial but easy walk to Chinatown and Darling Harbour, movies, shopping, buses. Some great coffee shops, restaurants underneath building. Staff very helpful and went out of their way to get me in early as I arrived at 8am.

Reviews.Title: “stunning views, large and clean apartment”
Reviews.Author: nickss1
Reviews.Content: stayed at property at the start of a round the world trip. booked through the property's website. no problems whatsoever. simply cab journey from airport after long flight from uk. checkin was simple process. the two-bedroom apartment was ideal. very large living area, well appointed kitchen with all that's needed. great flat screen tv, with good selection of channels, including fox sports (for english premier league). the bedrooms were large, bathrooms, very roomy. shower pressure was excellent. everything was top quality. housekeeping provided fresh towels etc everyday. easy walk to darling habour, and around 25 mins walk to opera house and habour bridge. i would throughly recommend this property, especially for a group of friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Good but better elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: artsyfarsty
Reviews.Content: We have stayed four times at Meriton World Tower, booking through Wotif.com. The apartments are well furnished and depending on the room and the levels that they are on the views can be quite spectacular. The prices we got in 2005 for our room was excellent value for money but over time this has not been the case. Still, when compared to other hotels in the area, the price is reasonable. Our interactions with the staff have been mixed, though most have been friendly and courteous. On one occasion during check in, I asked whether or not the contact number on the form had to be a home phone number and the young man behind the counter insinuated that my partner and I were having an affair, when I was simply worried about my information being sold to telemarketers! One of our pet peeves when visiting the Meriton World Tower is that if you are assigned a lower level you have to take two elevators to get down to the parking lot. This means taking the elevator to the lobby and then snaking your way around the lobby to the next elevator. It seems like a minor inconvenience on paper but there is a lot of time wasted doing this, especially with the exceptionally slow elevator service. If you are above a certain level, you are able to go straight to the parking lot. Another peeve is that although Meriton World Tower is a serviced apartment, there is a clause in the agreement you sign upon checking in, that if there is unwashed dishes left in the sink left that you will be charged. Check out mornings can be rushed and stressful unless you are awfully good the night before! All that being said, we would not have stayed so many times if the experience had been entirely unpleasant. If the prices at Wotif were similar to the prices we paid for the first few visits we would continue to stay there, they were a steal. These days however, there is better value for money, service and quality elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysSomewhere
Reviews.Content: Booked throught accommodation wholesalers australia and i found this the best place i stayed in sydney! great views, clean big apartments (3 bedroom) and i didnt have 1 complaint would certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “The view is amazing at the Meriton World Tower”
Reviews.Author: canberra1
Reviews.Content: Booked four nights at the Meriton World Tower's on WOTIF and was very impressed with our three bedroom apartment on the 72nd floor. I requested a high level floor mainly to get an unobstructed view over other buildings. The apartment was $249 per night and was spacious and the view was truely special out to Sydney Heads and Eastern Suburbs. The apartments are large and had two bathrooms. The pool area is great with a spa and sauna area attached. Small things that need attention eg no pool towels, housekeeping always later in the day around 3ish, reception staff not overly friendly or interested in you (apart from swipping your credit card) means that I would rate it 4.5**. The location is fantastic and the monorail stop is right next door and there are shops and a Coles suprmarket underneath the building. I will return but definitely ask for a high level apartment as the view is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: skibunnie630
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling with a family look no further. This is going to be the best deal you find in the city. The location is out of this world (2 blocks from Darling Harbour) and the views are to die for. We booked a 3-bedroom luxury apartment and paid less than the cost for most hotel room in the city. Our unit was located on the 73rd floor. Keep in mind that the Meriton World Tower is one of the tallest buildings in Sydney. When you first enter the unit you have a large foyer with a desk, phone and oversized closet. This place had more closets than most family homes! The kitchen was fully stocked with plates, silverware, and cleaning supplies. A double oven, stovetop and stainless steel refridgerator as well. The living and dining rooms were larger than most hotel rooms. The living area had a modern L-shaped couch, LCD TV and a DVD player. The entire unit has floor to ceiling windows overlooking the city. We weren't on the Darling Harbour side:-( but our view was still spectacular. It was like looking down on a street map! Each bedroom had a king-sized bed, plenty of luggage space, and multiple closets. The Master Bath had a jacuzzi tub and seperate shower, while the 2nd bath had a walk in shower that could fit an army. The small laundry room was the icing on the cake. We never made it to the indoor pool located on one of the mid-floors. We looked though and it was gorgeous...kind of scary with all the windows though! Internet is a charge which I was not happy about, but I realized that that was the case throughout Australia..very different from the US. All in all I could not find anything bad to say about this place. In my opinion it is one of the best I've ever stayed at and is the only hotel I would recommend in Sydney. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view”
Reviews.Author: derek1407
Reviews.Content: Amazing view if you are on a high enough view. Our apartment was large with 3 bedrooms and large living area. The apartments have a fully serviced kitchen and 2 bathrooms. Great location with a short walk to Darling Harbour or the Harbour Bridge. Would definetly recommend this place -especially good if you have a large group of people staying together.

Reviews.Title: “Meriton - Perfect location for Sydney stay.”
Reviews.Author: Tracey P
Reviews.Content: Our family of five (including the visiting inlaws) stayed at the Meriton earlier this month during a quick sight seeing trip to Sydney. Fantastic!!! The Meriton is perfectly placed for a visit - near the corner of George St near the cinemas. This makes it very accessible for public transport and cabs. There is a shopping centre underneath the plaza area on which the apartments sit - very convenient for small shopping trips to stock up on supplies. We had a three bedroom apartment on the 72nd floor. There were two bathrooms and each bedroom had a king size bed so lots of room for everyone. There was a sofabed in the living room. The bathrooms, kitchen and bedrooms were all top notch. The beds were hard (very hard!) but we didn't travel to Sydney for the beds. Views out of the windows were amazing and very impressive to the visitors. The apartment was starting to show wear and tear which probably needs to be addressed - and it would have been nice for the reservations staff to point out that there is a gorgeous indoor pool for guest use. Maybe next time. Something to keep in mind....because we had such a large group and needed a maxi cab...the staff arranged a private van to drive us back to the airport at an amazing price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing apartment, great view”
Reviews.Author: MolWat
Reviews.Content: I got a great last minute deal on this apartment and upon arrival I was amazed at the quality. My and my family stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment. Here we had wonderful views over Sydney. All of the fixtures and fitting were of very high quality and the apartment was clean and tidy. During our stay we had the benefit of being able to use a lovely swimming pool and jacuzzi aswell as a games room with a couple of pool tables. I would definately recommend this to anyone visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Facilities”
Reviews.Author: gemstar1974
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week stay in Sydney and had a marvellous time. We booked a 2-bedroom apartment at the World Towers which was as excellent as any 5-star hotel in the city. Prices were reasonable although the weekend rates are a bit hefty. Views of Sydney from the apartments are magnificent. The daily housekeeping service ensure that we have fresh towels each day. The personnel even washed all our plates and cups again even though we have washed them ourselves! The laundry and dryer came in handy as I was washing our toddler's clothes daily due to the mess that he sometimes get himself into. The fully equipped kitchen was a tremendous help as I was fixing wholesome and nutritous meals for our 23 month old toddler each day. The location of the apartments meant that I could pop down to Coles supermarket located in the basement of World Square anytime to get our daily essentials like diapers, formula milk as well as oats and cereals. If you need to rent a car which we did, you can just pop to Avis which is right around the corner on Pitt Street. The apartments are also close to Darling Harbour, Powerhouse Museum and Chinatown whic are just a short stroll away. QVB and Circular Quay are only a bus ride away. The receptionists on duty each day were very businesslike but helpful in assisting us with our needs. I wouldn't say that they are friendly except for the one who helped us book a day tour to the Blue Mountains. The only downside I have are the noisy party revellers jamming the lifts on the weekends. This is despite the fact that the property has a strict no party policy. Nonetheless, I was impressed with the facilities overall and would definitely stay here again when we come back in 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: queensreport
Reviews.Content: HIGHLIGHTS OF OUR STAY: 1. Arrived at hotel at 10 a.m. after an overnight flight and we checked in immediately. 2. Without requesting it were upgraded to a two bedroom, 2 bath on the 52 floor with an outstanding view of Darlng Habour. Balony glass enclosed so always usable. 3. Staff friendly and very responsive. We had trouble hooked up our internet and someone arrived without 10 minutes to solve the problem. Regardless of problem, we received the same prompt service. 4. Comfortable bed, bathrooms normal size but had long roomy counters. Important to me since I have lotions, potions, and makeup that take up lots space. 5. Close to food store, attractions, and Information office at Darling habour. Information recommended: Bontique Wine Tour(great all day trip to Hunter Valley--highly recommend), Blue Mountain(ended up the only two on the tour with Rob who owns the business. One on my favorite tours during our time there.), Sydney Habour Coffee Cruise a pleasant way to see the habour. 6. The building does seemed to be filled with mostly young adults. We did NOT find it noisy or in anyway affected by having so many young people living there. 7. Only negatives were the bacony needed to be swept and scrubbed before our arrival. Spa did not work the entire time we were there even after reporting it repeatly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Cheap beds, no service”
Reviews.Author: Nerd_girl
Reviews.Content: I am here in Sydney for a month at one of these serviced apartments. Overall I feel that my stay has been subpar. First the good - location, location, location. These apartments are in the middle of the CBD and a quick walk to many great things. There's a mall underground that has some decent restaurants, a grocery store, a drug store, a liquor store, and a video store. There are always a ton of cabs driving by. And within about 5 minutes you're at oxford street which has some cool shops and a ton of bars and clubs. The building is also pretty nice - the apartment I am in is on the 63rd floor. I have a view of Darling Harbor and the city. The decor is average, there's some random pictures on the wall, blue and tan carpeting that appears to be the type that easily masks stains.
